content:
Posted: 28 September
Year after year, EA, despite being one of the highest grossing video game company of all-time, you fail to actually deliver a product on release day that is reflective of its price. People are paying a premium for your games every year, and are met with some of the most lacklustre, mundane and boring features every year. Sure, you can blame us for continuing to buy the game, but the truth is, I love football. You love football. And FIFA/EA Sports FC is the only game out there that can scratch that itch. There are no viable competitors. Therefore, through our love for the beautiful game that is football, we keep buying it. And you know that, EA. That is why you refuse to actually do some hard coding in your game and add new features/improve the game.

You are too busy milking all the 12-year old FUTwhales that spend mum and dad's money on your stupid packs, which is all that ultimately matters to you in the end. You do not care that Career Mode has not been proper innovated since the dawn of Jesus Christ, or that Pro Clubs has so much untapped potential. All that matters to you, is FUT, and the whales that keep splashing thousands upon thousands every year, only for all of their players, items, to be obsolete the following iteration of FIFA/EAFC.

I would also like to point out that, despite us paying the same amount, the level of disrespect you have continuously shown us PC players is unforgivable. Not just this year, but every other year. Do not think we have forgot about the absolute disaster of a release that was FIFA 21, FIFA 22 and FIFA 23. If you are lucky enough to even launch the game, you are most likely met with terrible FPS, choppy animations, bugged out player models, and honestly, the list is endless if I wanted it to be. Speaking of lists, I am going to provide one with all of the bugs that I encountered in my first few hours of game-play.

→ Choppy animations, frames drop and becomes an eye-sore to watch.
→ Commentary does not work on launch. There is 0 commentary.
→ Player models, the hair, bugs out when it is rainy and foggy. Becomes pixelated.
→ Can not connect to the internet (whatever this means).
→ Controllers not working properly.
→ Game keeps minimising on PC.
→ The game is not opening and launching for so many players.
→ Can not sack coaches in Career Mode, it just freezes.
→ Objectives not counting.
→ Not getting XP when completing objectives.
→ The game freezes on the EA FC logo.
→ Stuck in half-time animation.
→ Game-play stutter.
→ Overall TERRIBLE performance even on high-end hardware.
→ Anti-cheat error message.
→ Media questions still make 0 sense.
→ Same animations for media interviews and transfers.
→ Same animations for injuries, etc. 0 innovation and creativity here.
→ Menu in FUT will freeze and you have to close the game and launch it again.
→ If you navigate the menu too quickly, it messes up and goes all over your screen.

Again, like mentioned, this list could be as long as you want it to be. The point is, you are incompetent EA, and you are ESPECIALLY incompetent when it comes to creating a proper PC port. But of course, because you know we love football and we simply have no other alternatives, you can keep getting away with this. I am an idiot for playing this game and "enabling it" and I know I am, but that is not going to stop me from speaking out about the disgrace of a company you run.

Also, why on Earth would you remove players walking out onto the pitch and lining up before a game? What went on in your heads over there at EA when you thought, hmm, let us replace this key part of immersion building and realism and replace it with a few stupid cutscenes then immediately throw you into the game where everyone is already on the pitch ready to go. What about Champions League nights, important finals, etc? There is no immersion anymore. You do not get to watch your team walk out, line up, with the anthem roaring in the background, your players lined up and ready to battle it out... it just sends you straight into action. This is SO stupid. As a Career Mode enjoyer (shock, I know right, cause who still willingly plays this neglected mode?) this totally kills off getting any sort of feeling towards your games, especially big ones. Mind-boggling decision. Begs the question, in typical EA fashion, what iteration of EA FC will you bring this back and market it as a "brand new, immersive feature"?

content:
Posted: 14 October
UPDATED REVIEW:

Please note that this is purely my experience of the game during the stupid hours I have sunk into it.

I won't be completely critical of the game and I'll give credit to a couple of things, most notably the gameplay. I like the animations and the motion of the players, they are fun to control. I play on normal gameplay speed and it feels great. Players are responsive and it is very fun trying to keep shape defensively (especially against ultimate difficulty) but with practice, you get there. Attacking is satisfying too, I like the different dribbling styles, although R1 dribbling at the time of this review is a little overpowered, but even still, I am happy that it's possible to dribble past players in this year's game and score some lovely solo goals.

I play purely offline, as where I am currently located I just cannot get a good enough connection to have any kind of online experience.

HOWEVER - despite EA releasing updates, not one of them has combated the biggest issue myself and many MANY others face, which is the abhorrent optimisation which is leading to stutters and for some, lag and game crashes.

I would not want to know how many of those hours I have spent trialling fixes and it is the first time in my gaming experience to encounter a game that just won't play. Sometimes a workaround will fix things temporarily, but upon the next launch, it just doesn't work again. This to me is unacceptable. They are aware of the problem, yet nothing has changed now for well over a month of it being released. The hell I've been through to sort it should never be required to play any game. I paid £80, but I feel like EA owe me a year's salary for the amount of work I've done on their game for them. Crooks.

Stutters in these kinds of games destroy any pleasurable experience you can get from it. Imagine playing an F1 game, but before every corner it stutters for 3 seconds and when it fixes itself, you've crashed into an entire neighbouring village and caused £500 million worth of damage, you'd say 'Forget it' and toss it in the bin. The same goes for football games. You need precision and reactions because timing is important. You can't do that with 3-second stutters intermittently during a match. How can nobody have seen this? I feel like Mugatu from Zoolander.

It was a new era for the franchise, a fresh start, so I allowed myself to believe that things may be different, but it just isn't the case for any of the offline modes. If you think adding cut scenes of players winning the Balon d'Or (where nobody even speaks other than some announcer, which freaks me out) and an open-top bus parade of trophies you've won (which is cool the first time, but it is the same every single time after) then you don't understand why we play football games - WE WANT TO PLAY, NOT SIT THERE AND WATCH SILENT MOVIES. Is this their attempt at making it more immersive? Disaster.

True, some promising ideas were introduced, like tactical vision and hiring coaches in manager mode, but here's the thing - that was bugged when it was released. Imagine working on a new feature, but for it not to work properly. What I mean is, that you can't fire coaches, you'll lock the game and have no chance to back out. I actually hope it doesn't get patched, because it doesn't matter, it tells us what we already know - they don't care.

It's a shame because I think that if they'd just put more effort into it, this could've been a really good game. The foundation is there with the gameplay, and that's the heart of any good football game. But why not just stop being a bunch of fraggles and develop your offline game modes more? The amount of work they put into 'create a team' for example, which was just uninspiring, is what I am talking about. Put that work into actually making a comprehensive, immersive career mode. 'Create a team' was fantastic in the F1 game, it works in that circumstance, but for a manager mode on a football game? It isn't what we want.

For those who can't be bothered to read all that: you'll feel just like Mugatu from Zoolander - It really is the same face.

content:
Posted: October 1
THIS IS BY FAR THE WORST FIFA EVER!
I have bought and owned all fifa releases since 2002 on the day it was released. I have paid a premium to EA every year for the fifa franchise for 21 years straight.
The game is absolutely disgusting and ridiculous. Yes they have made a few improvements like they do every year, but along with those improvements which are minimal like always, the things that are wrong with the game made me feel like i just wasted my money and time. I know there is a crazy amount of fifa fans out there, Please do not waste your money. I understand all the latest squads and transfers and other stuff we look forward to which is always discontinued in the last fifa when the actual transfer window begins. Wait for EA to release an update addressing the issues that are there in the game, if they address the issues at all.

Issues that have nothing to do with the gameplay-
*The display refresh rate settings are locked to 60fps. (On Laptop) (Desktop is Adjustable)
*The game stutters and lags and is absolutely impossible at times. This happens even on menu screens in career mode or any other, when you are not even playing a match.
*Drastic and random FPS Drops every 5-10 seconds.
I have a RTX 3060 laptop with 64GB RAM and a RTX 4090 high-end desktop. Same lag and stuttering on both machines. So definitely the problem is with the Game software itself.
This is what i get after paying a premium to one of the biggest franchises in the gaming industry. The game overall feels like it was incomplete in its development but the launch date had to be met. What a shame.

Gameplay Issues:

* The goalkeeper in the game is irrelevant.
* Shooting and finishing is the worst ever.
* Even though the ball control is better and there is an element of "centre of gravity" in the movement of the player in control which is nice, i still feel there is so much wrong in the overall movement of the player in control.
* Passing is the worst ever.
* First touch is inconsistent.
There is so much more wrong with the gameplay. And i am hoping that these issues will be addressed with an update. I would be shocked if this is how the game is meant to be.

To All the fifa fans out there. Wait for an update and fixes by EA. The game is not enjoyable and at times unplayable due to stutters and lags. Absolutely not worth a single penny of yours the way it is.

ULTIMATE TEAM REVIEW

COMPANION APPS REVIEW

Buy EAFC 24 if you want to play offline :)

content:
Posted: October 27
Having played FIFA titles competitively and consistently throughout the last 5-6 years, I can safely say without a doubt that this is the most horrific title ever released. This may seem like an overreaction (after all, how bad can a reskinned football game be right?!), and I wish it was, but it isn't in the slightest. I will break this down into some broad sections:

Gameplay:
Where do you start with this. It appears that, for what feels like the third time in a row in FIFA/FC franchises, that the AI is only capable of playing at a high level using high depth, direct passing tactics, that completely negate any form of tactical flexibility or stylistic influence you may wish to have (this may be my FM brain kicking in, but im sure most people dont ALWAYS want to play the same 90 minutes over and over again?). Having been in the elite divisions and consistently finishing FUT champs at around 16-4, I have not seen any variation, besides the starting formation to revert to the standard 4321 meta.

Player Flexibility:
With the new Evolution system being introduced, I, like many fans, were excited to see what layer of tactical flexibility this could offer to teams in ultimate team. Unfortunately, this feature is SEVERELY disappointing. In classic monopolistic style micro-transaction paradise, more 'premium' upgrades are locked behind what seems to be a ridiculously steep paywall (I am of the opinion that paying upwards of £15 for a single player upgrade is quite frankly outrageous). Furthermore, the restrictions are so draconian that only a select crop of players can be eligible. Take the 'Centurions Midfielder' upgrade, with an increased price of 150k coins (don't try to calculate how many games you would need to play) or 2k fifa points. The ONLY usable player in this selection that would be considered meta is Marcos Llorente (shocker!), and any other would be a waste of hard earned currency/ies. Like most years, the availability of exclusive players is so unbelievably high that you would have to wait until AT LEAST post Xmas for any hope of obtaining top level cards (and that is generous, since i'm basing this off of my experience in previous titles, having playing EVERY weekend league with consistent rewards). Would you like to use your favourite footballer, Kylian Mbappe? That is a shame, since you would need a literal mortgage on fifa points to afford just his services (lets not even get into top tier icon prices!!).

Remarkably, even due to the 'new' engine that was blessed to us two years ago on PC versions, the level of AI stupidity is quite frankly remarkable. Positional play is non-existent to be optimistic, and downright outrageous on the other end of the spectrum. Realistically, the only avenue of scoring is (you guessed it) Step 1: Buy fast wingers with playstyle+s that offer more 'pace' than their stats suggest (Chiesa is a good example), to then cut it back on a plate. There is no variation at the top level of the game, as this is the most achievable way of scoring a goal. The lacklustre player movement also extends to goalkeepers, who not only do NOT save shots with their actual hands (more so a forcefield aura around their gloves, magic!), but fail to make basic saving animations, and often find themselves locked into animations that they are unable to get out of. We've all seen Alisson Becker make a howler as he is diving sideways, despite the ball coming straight at him (I guess?).

For what feels like an eternity, EA have been very fast to implement micro transactions into their games without actually considering improving the fundamental gameplay, which in turn would give a more enjoyable experience and thus make people consider spending their hard earned funds on the game. When one of your landmark features in your ultimate team breakdown is the 'Claim All' Button, shouldn't you be looking elsewhere? New packs have been introduced which can set you back a literal weeks shop (if you're not careful). Thankfully there is some pushback in Europe from countries such as Belgium, but more needs to be done to recognise this in built slot machine, which, is also key to note, is listed as a PEGI 3 (ie. EA are perfectly morally ok with the fact that literal children could be gambling money on their game, just to get a virtual card which will be irrelevant in 12 months!!).

It is safe to say that this is the worst football game experience I have endured in a while. My likelihood of buying the next title is, for the first time ever, hit a new ground zero. I would encourage others to perform something similar until actual, effective, and purposeful change has been implemented to allow for tactical flexibility, gameplay consistency, and a fair playing field for all those who wish to play (from casual to professional players).

content:
Posted: October 11
I play solely on manager career mode so I upgraded to FC 24 mainly because I wanted to do one run as Inter Miami. I could have theoretically made it work by doing transfers on FIFA 23 until the roster was mainly the same but I decided to just go ahead and update the game so that the work would be done for me and so that I would get to try the new game.

Game is about the same overall, but I think it got some nice updates:
- Training is no longer required (or heavily featured) in career mode. I actually thought it was gone until I saw it as optional before game time. This was a big one for me because otherwise you were grinding for the "all As" with terrible players at the beginning of the season instead of playing actual matches.
- The cut the scene were they walk out - I know some people gripe about it, but I like how the intro is now shorter. I was skipping the walk out almost every single time so it overall felt like it was flowing a bit better
- The new traits are actually helpful - The trait that lets you dribble is nice and the trait to get longer lines in free kicks is awesome. The latter is one that I will actively scout for because it so useful and make those free kicks less of a guessing game.
- Looks are actually improved this time - When I upgraded for 22 to 23, the looks were objectively worse for me. In 24, the graphics are a bit nicer without requiring me to upgrade my video card.

Overall, if you have FIFA 23 and you can afford it, go for the upgrade. If the price tag is too steep, you are better off staying on FIFA 23 until they have a massive discount on a few months. If you hated 23, then you will hate FC 24 as it is essentially the same game with a few more bells and whistles.

content:
Posted: October 23
I bought this game last week and I'm almost 20 hours in. I'm in a bit of a unique situation as a *very* casual FIFA player. For context, I only recently started getting back into the sport as a spectator after a spell of not caring at all about sports, and as such I decided to buy EAFC 24 so I can play the game in the modern day. For context, the last and only FIFA game I ever had was FIFA 15, so almost 10 years between the editions I bought.

I'm also not your usual FIFA player in that I could not care less about UT. Sure, I'll open it every once in a while, do some objectives, open the reward pack/s and call it a day. But I'm not interested in the competitive play because I'm too ass at the game. If I were to load up a friendly right now I'd get stomped by someone who's played every FIFA since they were born and already has a team of icons and heroes and trailblazers. So, I only play manager and player modes. Mostly player mode, actually. Right now I'm about 4 months into my first year at Reading, with the intention of making the jump to the PL and becoming the world's best CF/CAM in existence.

Of course, this game is buggy. Even as a casual player, I see the bugs that this game has. It's just classic FIFA. I've already seen player models inside each other, incompetent goalkeeping, strange crowd chants for teams that aren't playing, crashes, player images not loading in UT cards, etc. I came into this game expecting this. The bar was low. But, it's been enjoyable. I've been having fun. Player career mode has been particularly fun. I've been on Legendary difficulty and am still able to perform well as an individual. It's not egregiously difficult where I can't score goals or dribble past defenders or make passes, but it's also not insanely easy where I score 4 goals every match and just farm the league. The one thing I really don't like is how the manager favor immediately decides your eligibility for starting 11. I dropped a stinker one game and my manager's favor dropped so much that I was a sub for the next three games despite me being a scoring machine, which doesn't make sense. If Haaland drops a stinker every once in a while and Pep decides to bench him for a month that'd be horrible. But I digress. And no, I don't restart games. I'm not a cheater. If my team loses, then my team loses. If I drop a stinker, then I drop a stinker.

Also, I hate to be that guy, but anyone that's been complaining about the game not running correctly has either never opened the options menu or has a really ♥♥♥♥ computer. I have a gaming laptop, so it's not a potato, but it's also not a full battlestation. The game runs fine at medium settings, hovering around 120 fps. The few times I've played online on FUT have been great and lag-less, which was something I remember very much struggling with on FIFA 15 when I had it.

If you're like me and only buy a FIFA once every few years, I would recommend this game. It has its charm and offers enough to keep you entertained, especially if you don't do UT either. Just make sure to lower your expectations. It's still EA and it's still FIFA. It's not at all perfect. But, it's fun, and that's what matters to me.

content:
Posted: October 2
If Your Game Crash After Connect to The Online Server

1) Quit game and quit EA app
2) Launch EA app
3) Log in with your EA account where you have game (linked with Steam)
4) Click on play EA Sports FC 24 from EA app, not Steam
5) Click on top left and GO OFFLINE
6)Launch the game from the same screen in ea app (when you are offline in ea app there will be a blue arrow to click on the screen to launch FC 24)
7)Enter main menu screen (before launching Ultimate team)
Click ALT Tab
Go to EA APP and click Go Online
8)Return to game
Enter Ultimate Team
Update squads
Play Ultimate Team and everything should work

content:
Posted: October 14
Obviously this is a new concoction and movement from the move when playing FIFA last season and switching to FC24 now, it's very similar to a new game, it doesn't feel like jumping one season but 2 seasons in the future. The newest third generation interaction from Hypermotion is directly referred to as Volumetric. The movement is indeed close to real players, its implementation in the Frosbite engine is really good to be applied to all real players with different physiques which have their own characteristics for each player's license, right, starting from the physical clothing worn and the physical anatomy of the body which is fairly accurate like this is a game with various dimensions of movement, what we actually feel is the same as when watching a live match on the field, each player character has different characteristics, body weight and height, which mutually influence their abilities, body position according to game tactics and timing. It makes more sense that sometimes we as players have difficulty guessing which direction to defend and which direction to exploit, it's very natural, very fluid, plus this playstyle is more assertive than the previous traits.

But that doesn't compare to the bugs offered to some other random players, on the device I play on the most annoying thing is the low-fps bug in cutscenes which tends to not be able to touch the minimum value of 60fps with the right aligned specs I have, you can imagine how much Nauseatingly, I saw 10-30 fps which was not constant but had massive ups and downs.

In terms of appearance, starting from menus, fonts and commentators, this is indeed EA's biggest leap this year, everything has been refreshed in such a way that the identity of the newest EA FC can be clearly formed that this is truly a game that cannot be separated from dependence on FIFA. But there is one thing that I hate to reduce playing this game for a long time, because you have to know that in EA FC24 there is no cutscene before the match for the cutscene of appointing the line-up, formation, and players when entering the field, lining up, and introduced. It's disgusting that there are no cutscenes like this, even though it's normal for football games, we play to feel the atmosphere firsthand and we pay according to the facilities available, but in fact it's not appropriate. It's really disappointing that EA FC doesn't want to share CUTSCENE LINE-UP or is this intentional to remove it, especially for NextGen users? Bad or rotten, for those of you who accept this major flaw, I can't consider it minor, to be honest.

And having entered TU3 since this review was written, my proud club, Chelsea FC, which has a licensed contract with EA, has not yet received an update on all its jersey kits with a new sponsor officially, even though it was introduced to the public long ago last week. I really can't think, look my flying hours are still low because of everything I'm telling you

content:
Posted: September 29
My honest opinion about the game and just so you know I'm a 41 year old gamer who's been playing his good share of video games on consoles for a while and have recently switched to PC gaming. I know most of the people say it's the same thing every year and yeah, they are right. You are basically buying an update for the teams and their roster every year with a few extra in-game animations. Almost the same thing most of you probably do when buying Call of Duty every year. Now, the most important thing about this. Am i having fun with it? So far YES! Does it work and runs well,smooth on my set up? YES it works perfectly fine with some tweaks of course (no stuttering,screen tearing or frame rate drops) So in the end it's really up to you if you want to buy it and try it (Just make sure your set up can run it please). Besides, You don't have to buy every single Fifa title every year, same thing with Call of Duty. You can always take a break from them every 1 or 2 years and you will see you will have fun the next time you buy those games. It's what i do and i suggest you do the same, otherwise you are gonna end up getting tired and hating on the franchise.

content:
Posted: September 29
EA FC 24 - A Game Marred by Glitches and Bugs

I recently had the chance to play the latest release of EA FC 24, and while there are certainly aspects to appreciate in the game, I couldn't help but be disappointed by the numerous glitches and bugs that plague the experience.

The Good:

1. Improved Gameplay: EA FC 24 does bring some improvements in terms of gameplay mechanics, including better ball control and more realistic player movements.

2. Graphics: The game boasts impressive visuals, capturing the essence of football with lifelike player models and stadiums.

3. New Skill Moves: EA Sports has added new skill moves to the game, which adds some variety to your gameplay strategies.

The Bad:

1. Bugs and Glitches: This is where EA FC 24 falters. The game is riddled with bugs and glitches, ranging from minor annoyances to game-breaking issues. "No Commentary" bugs, freezing, and crashes are common.

2. Unplayability: Some players have found the game virtually unplayable due to these issues, having to restart it multiple times just to enjoy a session.

In conclusion, EA FC 24 has the potential to be a great football game, but its current state is marred by technical issues that hinder the overall experience. EA Sports should prioritize fixing these bugs to make it the game it has the potential to be. Until then, I would suggest to hold off on purchasing or wait for updates to address these issues.

content:
Posted: November 2
The worst game ever in regards to optimization.
Not only am I covering the PC requirements but I shall be able to play at Ultra without any lag.
But still, even when playing with the lowest graph the game still lags and ruins that ruins everything.
The most ridiculous thing is that just after the release it was running smoother than now after updates, patches and so on.
Yes, there was still lag from time to time but when playing with MAX graph, not with MIN as now.
I'm starting to think that EA posted false system requirements to scam people to buy their game or the only thing they do to the game is make it worse with every next patch and update.
There are good things though - the player's motion is great and more realistic than ever. Mechanics-wise the game is the greatest Fifa so far. Totally love the way the players interact and act as a whole.
But it's freakn unplayable with all the lag.
I even thought about upgrading my PC but then I realized that the problem isn't on my side so even if I upgrade this otherwise amazing game will remain unplayable because of the lag.
I feel cheated.

content:
Posted: October 5
Playing this game after paying $70 for it, I honestly feel robbed. When I first got on, I wasn't even able to play with my friends on Xbox due to an "update" causing the crossplay feature to break. Once that got fixed, we would get errors nearly every time we'd queue up for a match. We'd have to leave and rejoin the lobby every single time, and hope that it would happen to actually put us in a match. The menus are also atrocious - it seems like EA tried to design them in the most confusing way possible. It is extremely annoying how you have to enter a 10-15 second loading screen between each section of the menu. If you want to adjust simple settings, like video brightness or audio volume, you have to back out all the way to the main menu screen to do it. During halftime within games, you have to press THREE BUTTONS to skip the cutscene, with a delay between each button. I genuinely don't understand why it would be necessary to press so many buttons to perform ONE action.

The gameplay feels really bad too. There were so many games were we needlessly lost the ball/got scored on because of server lag. The bots that are placed on your team are pretty much braindead, passing the ball to the enemy team at every opportunity. It is extremely frustrating to make impressive, difficult plays, only for it all to be ruined by a bot giving the ball away. Also, if you don't have the right stats, your character will pretty much lose every game. They will not win duels, make goals, or even pass the ball correctly if you don't have the perfect characteristics. What's the point of all the customization if only one setup will work well? I don't feel any sort of satisfaction from this game whatsoever. It is so poorly designed that trying to invest time to improve would just be a waste.
found_helpful: 5 people found this review helpful 1

content:
Posted: September 29
FIFA 23 was a step in the right direction. FC 24 feels like 2 steps backwards from that. FUT PC transfer market is still separated from consoles, meaning there's barely anything to buy on PC. Mouse keeps being automatically locked in the middle while idle, resulting in controllers/joysticks not working in some menus. They removed players cutscenes walking out onto the pitch and lining up before a game, etc. There's a lot of problems I could list, but it's not worth my time.
BTW about the Women in FUT drama: women mixed with men sounds like it'll be a fun alternative for people tired of the same, however I see why it's considered by many as 'Forced Diversity': if it was difficult to pack your favorite players before, now imagine in FC24 where there'll be a lot of extra WSL players in FUT packs. Personally I don't care but it could be easily fixed if devs separated women & men packs, so you get 10x 83+ with only women or only men, depending of what you choose. But of course they won't do it because they want people failing to pack their favorite players, more packs being opened = more money spent by players = more money for them.
Oh and they've said they will close FIFA 21 servers in November 2023, so maybe they will close FC 24 servers on November 2026 ? And every year, around September, they purposefully take out the specials cards from the 10x 85+ packs, basically only giving you ♥♥♥♥♥♥ gold players at the end of the lifespan of FUT so you buy the next game instead. That's a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ move by them and I think more people should be aware of their scummy tactics.
Anyways, I'll keep playing FIFA 23.

content:
Posted: October 8
I play FIFA since 90s until 2013, I decided to get back.
I have fc 24 in both PS5 and PC.
PS5 has so much love from EA, no crash, no bugs 'played Player career mod and UT' PS tournaments ..etc . on PC omg Crashes, if you used mouse or keyboard when launching the game you won't be able to use controller you need to restart, going to market to buy a player or changing formation in mid game sometimes you can't go back and you end up altF4 and losing the match.
*Also no cross-progression.
PC pros : Faster loading time, fps and video quality.
for me game is fun and probably gonna play on both pc in my room and on ps5 in living room.
If you have console buy it there. if not wait for 2 months as always game will be on sale.
Until EA decide to give PC players some love I will recommend it.

content:
Posted: October 7
Every corner, every free kick, every goal celebration is laggy and drops by like 100 fps. I have high end pc and still can't play this game without it dropping frames, being laggy, get stuck on eafc logo. So many times i have launched this game and it didn't even recognize that i have controller connected via bluetooth.
Gameplay is ♥♥♥♥ as well:
- R1 or RB dribbling is the most op thing EA have made in the last 5 fifas. You just can't defend it no matter how good you are. There is nothing you can do if player with dribbling playstyle holds R1 or RB and comes at you
- If you face equal team you can win fairly, if you face common golds you can have 17 shots on target, while your enemy has 1 and you still will lose 0:1.
- Every time you get corner, goal celebration, free kick expect your fps to drop by ~100 frames.
- Your GK turns into prime Loris Karius everytime you have a lead in champions game.
- A 5,2ft 60 phy female will body your Van dijk in every corner.
- A 50 pace defender will catch your 93 paced Nunez without breaking a sweat, unless you run down the wing then even a 91 paced defender(Balde) can't catch a 50 paced female.
- Roflo is better than Mbappe, Dembele (make it make sense EA.)
- 80% of corners is a guaranteed goal.
- If you don't play with with 2 cdms on stay back while attacking you will lose 5:0 no matter how good you are.
- Apparently Van Dijk and Araujo can't stop and body a female named Rodman ( i see what you did there EA)
- Some of the playstyles is super OP and you can't do anything to counter them.

Overall this game is one of the worst ea football games in a long time. They somehow made a game that seems super realistic and super unrealistic at the same time. Not worth the 60 euros, wait for sale if you want to enjoy clubs or career. FUT is completly unplayable at times.

content:
Posted: October 2
This is quiet frankly (as much as I hate to say this) a horrible game. For someone to spend $100+ on this game in the world we currently live in for it to only work when it wants to is daylight robbery. Whether I play Career mode Manager or Player, Ultimate Team or even just a Kick Off game I cannot leave the game once finished, I have to exit the game completely then enter it again. My controller which works perfectly fine on games like NBA2k, NHL, UFC etc but turns to absolute ♥♥♥♥♥ when playing this. Barely able to do simple tasks like moving through the menus without skipping every 2nd option. Mixing this with all the bugs that haven't been fixed in Fifa 23 that continued in this I strongly suggest to not buy this game for at least 12 months till at least half of these are fixed... you're wishing for a miracle for them to do it all in one patch. The only way for myself to play this game with a smile on my face is for me to buy a New Gen console $800+ and a completely new game that's another $100+... So i'll be waiting for EA to reimburse me with my money I have spent to go towards the $900+ I need to play the game or any future FC titles in the future... Like many PC players we are furious with how this game has started. Utterly disappointed yet again. Nice of you to bring Women's Leagues and players into Ultimate Team it's greatly appreciated for Women's Football Fans but fix your game.

content:
Posted: September 30
Excellent game. Great controls. The ultimate team mode is very fun. Ultimate team does have pay to win elements, but you can also play it casually. If the pay to win bothers you, there is also seasons mode in which you can play a team against other players online, and the game will track your progress. There are several other game modes as well : manager, club mode, and volta. Volta is interesting and I admit that I have not tried it yet. It is a street football mode in which you control one player online, and it tracks your progress. I am really excited to jump in that when I have the time.


They have added women into the game in several game modes. I think this is wonderful! You can play the most popular game mode, ultimate team, and have both male and female players on the same team. I LOVE IT! Women can now feel included, and that is what we all want right? This is a wonderful thing! I hear EA is doing that with other sports as well and that motivates me to try out those games. It isn't fully integrated yet. You can not play women's teams in managers mode. I did read an article that hinted it will be in future versions of this game.

content:
Posted: October 8
This is my first ever review of a game, having played the Fifa franchise since 2004.

I play on PC, and have clocked almost 70 hours since the launch of EAFC. Now, all of a sudden, I'm unable to access EAFC Online or Ultimate Team. I have no internet connection issues, have uninstalled and reinstalled the game (as well as the EA App and the Anticheat), yet I am still unable to access the game.

There is also a 52 page long thread on the EA Help website showing others who have had the same problem, and have done so since launch. What I think is most bewildering is that it's a 52 page long thread, and there is not one response from EA's support team to help rectify the issue.

Wouldn't recommend spending $100 on a game that you're unable to play.

content:
Posted: October 18
I don't recommend this game.

Worst of its series. Worst football game I've played in YEARS. Never have I seen this amount of bugs in a previous series before. EVER. I took a small break because I had enough of the bugs, and today I started up the game again.

Played FUT Champs.
3rd game in.
I'm leading in the 87th minute.
The guy pauses.
I score a goal...
the game doesn't PAUSE....
Then in the 91st minute after a random pass, the game PAUSES and stays like that for 15 minutes. Counted.

I instantly quit the game and uninstalled it.

The ONLY good thing they've done this year is that they've made Pro Clubs cross-play. That's it. Still not worth it for me with the amount of bugs.

Not to mention the unplayable game itself. The meta this year is the absolute worst - the only way you can score is by running down the wing, into the box, do some mumbo jumbo and pass into the centre - goal most of the time. Everyone does it, and I don't blame them. It works. It's almost November and they haven't bothered to change it, so it looks like it will stay like that for the rest of this year.

It's impossible to actually try and play proper football, I find myself often switching between my full backs because there is no space in the middle. I've tried multiple formations and tactics, and I've seen a lot of really good youtubers talk about this as well. It's literally unplayable - there is no attacking intelligence from the AI.

Also, defending this year sucks. It feels like EA is punishing you for making good tackles.

I was looking forward to Career Mode too.... when my fun was ruined by a bug in the Coaches menu. You can't fire a coach - if you try to do it, a menu you can't close or interact with, will pop up, so you're forced to close the game - meaning you should only hire coaches if you're 100% certain you'll stick with them for the rest of the save.

The game feels passionless. A corporate's product. Lifeless.

Won't touch ever again.

content:
Posted: October 3
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.
This is by far the worst football game I have ever played...

It is so poorly optimised for PC, there is constant lag, input delay, jitter, stutter, and more. It gets worst at cut scenes and set-pieces(during and after).
The menus are severely delayed, you will press on one section and it wont work so you press on something else, only for the first thing to finally load.

Lets talk about game play.. the meta is all about pace. No matter the occasion, if you run down the wing with someone with 90 pace, nothing can be done. Then run up the touchline, sweaty goal, simple... OR if you mark the sweat, just blast the ball and the keeper lets it in..

The game play might be complexity different if they patch the game and make it playable so you can counter the meta... but this is EA.. they don't care, as long as people are buying points.

Pay to win is alive and well, I got the game on early access and every match since has been against 90 rated squads with the likes of Haaland, Mbappe and all the other OP players.
The struggle for people earning players and playing matches legit is higher than ever.

I would get a refund if I could but unfortunately I redeemed my pre-order bonus making me ineligible for a refund... Yes I am the biggest moron of everyone for pre-ordering an EA game.

Normally you play a video game in order to have some fun or to relax and unwind. But this is a different game. And every year becomes worse and worse. content:

After 70+ hours in the game, I cannot say that I recommend this game to anyone, except the ones who bought this just for the sake of updating the squads. The Ultimate Team experience is just annoying this year for some reason, and the Career mode has continued to be boring at most times.

Aside from the customary reports of bugs, glitches, and more that plague the experiences for many, the game just does not feel good to play. Passing, tackling, shooting, all seem to be have been made unnecessarily awkward for most players. Overall, I can give it a 4/10 experience at max. However, if you really wish for an upgrade, I would suggest that you wait for a sale to get this at its deserving price.

content:
Posted: November 1
From 1998 to 2012 i owned every single Fifa and PES Game, man have i spent a lot of good time with these games and have i enjoyed my time with them. When the first ultimate team stuff started happening i stopped buying these games and have not touched any football game for about 10 years. with the switch from fifa to "fc" i thought: give it another try" and oh my god i am missing the words to describe how much of a microtransaction hell this game has become. never mind the fact that the menu navigation is utterly atrocious and takes you ages to start a game. the transfer market being ridiculously bad design, no way to do proper bulk selling apart from doing it with automated pricing which then screws you over, 2 different ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ currencies you have to juggle between opening microtransaction ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ crates out of 2017 and reselling them in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ marketplace in which 90% of players/cards are worth nothing, and only the artificially inflated top player cards - who not only are "gold", no they are "heroes" or "legionnaires" and whatever else ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ EA has come up with - are worth an absolute ♥♥♥♥ ton which is absolutely unachievable from just playing the game, unless you spent real money. honest to god, the amount of bullshittery in this game is absolutely mind boggling.

i guess the actual gameplay is alright, muscle memory had me pretty comfortably winning even in online after a short while. But the utter frustration from everything that lies between two matches has me uninstalling the game and staying away for another 10 years. ♥♥♥♥ this absolute and utter microstransaction hellscape. i played overwatch, world of warcraft, league of legends and hell, i own about 300€ worth of stellaris DLCs, i genuinely dont mind paying for games but THIS ♥♥♥♥? ♥♥♥♥ no.

content:
Posted: November 1
EA FC, despite some optimization issues on PC, impressively outperforms FIFA 23 in several aspects. The introduction of Hypermotion technology is a game-changer, enhancing player animations and making the in-game action more lifelike than ever. The improved player movement and responsiveness create a smoother and more immersive gaming experience. While PC optimization may need some work, the overall gameplay experience is a notable improvement. EA FC's superior performance and the enhanced realism brought by Hypermotion undoubtedly make it a promising step forward for the FIFA series, setting a higher bar for future iterations in the franchise.

content:
Posted: October 28
As soon as I stepped onto the pitch I was filled with a desire for something... A drink- a beverage of some sort (btw i live in Ohio) I realized my tummy was rumbling specifically for the Grimace Shake. So I got my level 9 gyatt up and got in the rizzler mobile and made my way to McDonalds on Sigma Street. I order the grimace shale and as i went up to the counter to pay i realized the cashier was Livvy Dunne. This was it! I quickly called my Best Buddy Baby Gronk so he could rizz her up in Ohio for the grimace shake with my level 9 gyatt. He came and they got along quickly and i was happy for him. But days went by without contact from Gronk and i realized by getting him to rizz up Livy Dunne I pulled him far away from me and i had lost my best buddy. Years went by and I gained depression and was drinking more often until... One day on rizzbook i saw the news that filled me up with light and hope " BABY GRONK HAS BROKEN UP WITH LIVY DUNNE!" I stumbled to my phone and called Baby Gronk and he was happy to hear from me and being honest tears were shed during the call. Now in present day Im happy and Best Buddys again with Baby Gronk he admits to making the biggest mistake in his life but it doesnt matter anymore to me im happy now and i will be forever more with my level 9 gyatt in Ohio with Baby Gronk with NO MORE RIZZING UP LIVY DUNE. Anyways the games aight

content:
Posted: October 12
I bought the game to try it out but like other players, the quality looks like an arcade game. Do you remember soccer pro the arcade game? I played that in the pub over 30yrs ago. It literally had two buttons (pass and shoot) and a joystick. FC24 is exactly the same visually, which is very sad, I have played FIFA22, (didn't bother with FIFA23 since there was no difference). But looking at FC24 it has gone backwards in visual content. How is that possible? This was supposed to be revolutionary, but it isn't. The career mode game play is good, that's about it. With PC I could figure out very easily the routine movements or passing options and cut them out, this is a bit more adaptive. But still, for this money, I expect magic. Sadly it isn't there. Makes me wonder if FIFA employed the actual game programmers previously responsible for the game to make them FIFA 26, since these graphics and stuttering and speeding up with lag - it’s so so bad?
Apart from that, it still has that stupid glitch from 2022 where you can’t scroll sometimes and you have to use the mouse then it works.
All the pregame and postgame questions are exactly the same as Fifa22 – what you couldn’t be bothered to make it more realistic? There should be a thousand random questions, we have about 10…
Also, asking how I beat the team again when it is the first game of the season? Or am I going to be out of the relegation zone when I am in the top 4 with 2 games left? Seriously? And it’s the same ♥♥♥♥ now. I played West Ham first time in FC24 and the question is what did I do different from the last game. Er, first game against them. Fix this ♥♥♥♥ please. It was annoying in FIFA22 but this is lazy. Even worse when it doesn’t know sometimes what team I am managing..
And, in manager career mode, when you lock to player, you can’t use the select button to see where your player is (like in player career mode), that makes no sense. AND the goalkeeper, he just randomly kicks the ball anywhere and you always lose the ball and get counter attacked. There should be a way to direct his kicks toward you. But, I have to run back to defence from my position and hope I am in time for a ground pass before he launches it pointlessly forward. Often, he kicks it before I get there. That’s poor.
Overall, the CPU gameplay is much better, less predictable, but otherwise, I see a very lazy FIFA22 game. I didn’t play FIFA23, but seeing this, it’s literally FIFA22 but with worse graphics (FIFA15 was even better – how is that possible?). I don’t get it. Only the interface has changed (bright white and black, wtf?) and penalties/ free kicks/ corners are more detailed.
For me, the CPU gameplay is good, which is what I do mostly, but the rest is just the same and not worth the money.
For this money, considering what everyone was anticipating - it’s a joke to be honest. And I thought FIFA were a corrupt bunch of balloons…

Match making is terrible. You play a 3 star team you actually like/support? don't worry, we will match you with a 4.5 star team. Every time.

I regret not returning it for a refund after two hours.

content:
Posted: October 7
This game is worse than FIFA 23. There are few changes that I do like for example the new UT menus I think they're pretty nice and Squad Battles length being much shorter than it previously was but that is all the good I can say about this game. The negatives severely outweigh the positives. the worst aspect of this game is it feels ridiculously scripted I know the last games have always had this aspect but on this version there will be games where I cannot leave my own half and the opponent is effortlessly gliding into my box and getting into goal scoring chances even though I know I am defending as well as I possibly can but that still doesn't help. I thought FIFA 23 was bad for making me angry, this game has made me the angriest I have ever been in my entire life. I can handle losing if I know it is just a skill issue but this game just feels against my every move. passing on this game is also so bad I am always losing the ball because my player has passed in the complete opposite direction than the actual way I was aiming my sticks. the online is already way too sweaty but the only way to make coins is to play Rivals and Champs which are dreadful to play. I spent most of my time in Squad Battles so I was actually enjoying it until I started to play Rivals and Champs and those modes are why I am even writing this. I was actually looking forward to this game when they showed new changes off prior to reveal but now I just wish I didn't spend my money on this. I brought this on myself.

content:
Posted: October 1
Worst FIFA Ever
You go to FIFA - you crash on a video clip
You go to Ultimates Team - FIFA crashes

Do you want to come over and play? Use offline mode in EA or VPN and then log in

♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ EA client that requires authorization every day, it’s hard to configure data saving.

You set up a defense system, game tactics, a game plan for each player - your defenders stand still and watch the attacker with their eyes. WORST DEFENSE MECHANICS.

Graphics - what is it? FIFA 2015? What a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ field, in the menu 30 fps, pixels. Why do I need your animations of bodies and faces during free throws when 95% of the time I look at the field?

The “Fifa doesn’t want you to score” system is simply ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up. You lead 3:1, 2 minutes later 3:5.

Women at UT.. Do you know how many aerial serves a woman with a rating of 90 has won? 0. A man defender with a rating of 60 and a woman with a rating of 90 are running - the man will win

You play in UT, you want to leave the match - the Leave match button is simply not pressed, the match ends - it says that you left the match. What the ♥♥♥♥? Then you get thrown out of UT because the workload is heavy. I was just here, what?

Ew, ♥♥♥♥

content:
Posted: September 29
EA has been super consistent lately. Consistently bad. Somehow they copy pasted FIFA23 and made it even worse. I can only speak for Ultimate Team as I haven't tried anything else yet, but the game is still broken af.

You may notice gameplay feels super sluggish and slow. Here is a guide to make it somewhat more bearable:

1. Make sure your in game framerate matches your monitor refresh rate. I have a 165Hz monitor and this caused input lag when the game was capped to 60fps.
2. Change display mode to borderless.
3. Frames per second: No limit
4. Dynamic scaling: Disabled

FOR NVIDEA GPUs:
1. Go to NVIDEA Control Panel
2. Go to Manage 3D settings, then Program settings
3. Select EA FC 24
4. Antisotropic filtering: 4x, low latency mode: ultra, multi-frame sampled aa: off, power management mode: prefer maximum performance, texture filtering - anisotropic: on, texture filtering - negative LOD: allow, texture filtering - quality: performance, texture filtering - trilinear: on, threaded optimization: on, vertical sync: fast.

This will by no means fix all the issues, but makes it much more bearable to play. There will still be a noticeable input lag, especially on higher refresh rate monitors.

At the end of the day, the ultimate solution is to just not buy this piece of ♥♥♥♥ "game".

content:
Posted: October 5
As an offline-only player that has continued purchasing basically every annual recycled edition of FIFA, I must also concede that this is probably the most substantial set of improvements to manager career mode that I've seen in years. It's not revolutionary, nor is it even as much of an improvement as it SHOULD be, but I'm also really enjoying it. Some notes for other manager career-focused players:
+ The tactical focus (e.g. counter-attack, slow build up, tiki-taka, etc.) and respective coaching staff balancing act is a modest but NET positive change. Not only does it just FEEL better to be able to have an organizing theme guiding a team's playing style, but it also makes it way easier to quickly assess an upcoming opponent's style and try to adjust strategy accordingly. And I like the *idea* of building out a coaching staff, and its current impacts are palpable and displayed clearly, but it definitely still feels more tacked on than truly well-integrated. I hope they expand on this thread a bit more in future iterations.
+ Tactical view for manager career, where you can simulate the game in real-time without directly controlling any of the players. I can't tell you how long and how desperately I've hoped for exactly this. I was glad when they implemented the top-down, circles-as-players sim option a couple iterations ago, but this tactical view is precisely what I've fantasized about!! I can finally get a vivid, fully-realized look at how the team and the tactics play out without my input, and it honestly feels more rewarding to see the team I built win this way than when I'm putting my literal finger on the scales by playing directly
+ Playstyles -- basically the "traits" system, evolved -- truly do feel like they meaningfully change a player's AI and capability beyond their raw player ratings, and better yet makes it easier for me to imagine players with distinct personalities and team roles.
+ Hypermotion: I can't believe it, but I genuinely think the animations feel tangibly improved from previous years. Acceleration, jockeying, dribbling, and other movements truly feel more natural and believable. Way moreso than in prior years when they've shoveled the same buzzword bull****
+ Though not really "new", I continue to explicitly appreciate the extensive customizability of the interface and difficulty (including user/CPU sliders as well as choosing the level of automated targeting in passing/shooting or player switching)
+ I generally avoid Ultimate Team, but I am very happy they included females in the same player pool. The whole game mode premise is pure fantasy, so why not!
~ The pre-game training session prep. Basically, you can optionally participate in the training sessions available in former games, but this time around it gives temporary playstyle benefits for an upcoming game. I like this in theory, but the lack of flexibility (for example, players are automatically assigned and you can't change which ones are given which benefits) undermine the usefulness. I still use this for big upcoming games, and it feels like a better inclusion of training sessions than in past games' fitness/sharpness balance.
- Basic and longstanding UI frustrations, such as not being able to see players' potential (e.g., "Showing Great Potential", etc.) for arbitrary reasons, like when they're on loan, their contract is expiring, or they're a free agent. Or inexplicably not allowing us to see the full scouting profile (including the text-hint for the hidden potential stat) of a player from the transfer shortlist. Like... come on.
- The fact that there is still basically no way to assess players' potential outside of the one-note textual hint mentioned above. Like, it's suddenly apparent if a player has 80 potential or above, but heavens forbid it's at 79 or they've just turn age 22, then suddenly a scout is rendered completely unable to render ANY opinion on how much they might improve. How is this still the only way?? Why can't there be a seemingly more reasonable and realistic "High growth potential" phrase or something, and/or a graph of a player's rating change over time??
- The pathetic attempts at player "personality", delivered via chat messages that only have like 4 total message options that usually amount to "Please play me more!" Either improve it or delete it at this point. It's asinine.
- The morale/fitness/sharpness system in general. It didn't feel like it added anything useful to the game, with unclear impacts on play. I pretty much set it and forget it at maximum energy recovery, and never felt the need to change it
- Some pretty game-breaking bugs, including an unavoidable where the menu interface permanently locks when you try to fire a coach (which you will almost definitely want to do as you get more spending money), requiring a full game exit and restart. I've literally stopped playing for the moment until this gets fixed, and the bug has been explicitly acknowledged by EA for several weeks but still hasn't been patched. Even for EA, that's low.

Overall: Still an abysmal year-over-year improvement from EA in basically all of their sports franchises, but I confess that this is the first EA soccer/football game in a while that has actually felt worth the purchase, for the most part. At least for manager career players!

First, the contract feature is so redundant in the Ultimate Team mode, but for some reason unknown to me, it has been kept in this new iteration of the title. Worst of all, you have to purchase contracts in order to play games further. I just don't understand why we have to go through all of the trouble to renew players' contracts ONE BY ONE in order to play the game. This feature is certainly not part of the fun. It is just annoying.

Second, the gameplay is still sluggish as it was in its previous iteration, fifa 23. I just don't understand why it cannot return to the way it was in fifa 14, which is the most successful iteration of all of its cohorts. When I play in the matches, I just feel like I am controlling the characters running in the mud! I certainly DON'T RECOMMEND this game to anyone

content:
Posted: October 9
I don't know why people are complaining about the Crashes happened a few times to me but only ever in menus never in games, on top of that on console the game crashes a whole lot more.

Evolutions are awesome in my opinion really good feature.

Games fell not to fast and not to slow and with the addition of playtyles and playstyle+ makes games feel a little bit more interesting.

To the people who cant defend all i have to say is GET GUD, defending is ez in my opinion i have kno clue why people are moaning about the defending lol.

Last thing i should talk about women, cool feature absolutely love abusing them against people who cant defend and to the people that complain about their rating go cry in a corner you little ♥♥♥♥♥ :)

In conclusion i will give FC 24 a 8/10 pretty fun compared to F23 which i would have rated 6.5/10

content:

At first my review was negative, but I haven't played in years and didn't give the game a chance initially. I was already having flashbacks of 2021 on PC. The very first thing I did when I turned on the game was get smoked like 4 games in a row playing co-op with a buddy that wasn't pulling his weight on the pitch.

After playing it for a couple hours, it grew on me. Mechanics are pretty solid, movement is smooth. Cross platform is a huge win. I've always loved Soccer(Futbol), and always will.

*Cross platform working flawlessly now. Finding drop-in club games on the first try. Thank you!

***If you're in pro-mode and trying to do skill challenges, the game freezes upon completion of each one and you have to hard close the game and re-open.

*If you could work on a resolution, it would be greatly appreciated.

Ridiculous pacing with midfielders its like steering a barge when trying to move them around, if theres a AI counterattack good luck all your midfielders will watch them run by and if you have a player close that can intercept then it takes them so long to turn and move that they will be blown past and thats before you consider the ball clipping through your players.

Goalkeepers take way too long to pick up a ball right in front of them and then their animation starts getting choppy before they throw or kick the ball away.

This is actually terrible.

content:
Posted: November 5
Honestly, I really like FC 24. Ultimate team does have some issues from what I see, however I don't play it all too much so I don't know those issues first hand. I do however really like manager mode and having the sim matches act like a Football Manager style screen. I know I could just go play Football manager if i wanted, but it's nice to be able to jump in and play as well as monitor the game.

Player career is the same as usual, it's always been fun starting with a low team like say English league 2 and working your way up.

My biggest thing for getting it this year was finally crossplay. My nephew plays on his PS5 and I can play with him on my PC, be it on Ultimate team or pro clubs.

I know it's another yearly release and EA aren't always the best with their Fifa games, or FC this year, but I am really enjoying this game and it's a step up from previous games.

content:
Posted: November 3
EA FC 24 is a dismal excuse for a football game, showcasing a shameful lack of innovation and blatant money-grabbing tactics. The graphics are woefully outdated, the gameplay is clunky, and the AI is nothing short of brain-dead. Career mode is a boring and uninspired grind, and the incessant microtransactions taint the entire experience, making it abundantly clear that EA's primary goal is to drain your wallet rather than provide an enjoyable gaming experience. Steer clear of this title at all costs; it's a prime example of everything that's wrong with the gaming industry today.

content:
Posted: October 5
Playing for the Ultimate Team.
The addition of Women players is massive, makes more variety which will only expand as each promotion drops. Evolution is interesting which also creates more diversity in teams as you can upgrade any player you like not just meta players (more to come).
New playstyles makes pace not as important but still important, new position change makes drafts and normal games more convenient.
Playstyles makes players more unique unlike last year where players felt generic when they had the same stats.
Haven't had the first week of futchamps but its been decent. Pay 2 win will never go away but gettin a decent team is achievable at the start.
Gameplay is slightly different, crossing is more viable, 5back and 3 back is now banned in competitive play so there should be less rats. Cutback is still too common though. The finishing is also of more variety with new animations, finesse is more effective inside the box, and shooting playstyles will be sought for (chipping, trivela, power shot).

Pro Clubs solo on pc is not working at the moment but this year it is Cross-platform so worth getting once patched.

content:
Posted: October 9
Your trial has ended, do you want to revisit your review?

First of all I want to point out I only play career mode and none of the online features.
I really tried to like it. So much so I went to EA Play Pro once my trial was over so I can give it a chance. Spent around 10-15 hours in it and it is over for me.

So what is wrong with it? It's just bad. Very clunky, gameplay is super slow and weird. Defending is non-existent to the point that your defender is running away from the attacker, the AI is so scripted the ball literally goes throw your defenders like they are ghosts and it is just visible the game decides "oh you are losing this one". Horrendous. I don't think I should use sliders to compensate for the incompetence of EA to actually make their AI either good or bad, but not just switching from slow and confused to rocket in a second. I play FIFA since 05 and this is by far the worst scripted one. And last but not least, it just feels like an arcade game, no cutscenes at the start of a match? Why? Who thought that career mode players would want that??? Anyways, this is the first time I am actually downloading the previous game so I can atleast play some football. I can honestly say at this state FC24 is by far the worst product EA could've come up with.

Posting my original review, so people can see I actually wanted to give it a chance:
Don't mind the very small time I spent in the game, unlike many others my game runs fine and it boots without any issues.
Also know I only play offline/career mode so I cannot speak of how the game performs online.

Like FIFA23 I keep getting my SSD randomly spiking to 100%, making the game pretty much unplayable. It used to do it like twice a match, which was fine but now it does it like 10 times a match, sometimes it freezes multiple times in the span of one minute. I see EA "support" says we should check our disks for issues, but every other game I play goes fine and never does that. My PC is not high-end and besides those super annoying freezes it is quite enjoyable and different.

content:
Posted: November 5
Afwul. Cash grab. That's all there is to this.

How can a company that earns that much, be this bad at actually coding a game to run well. Here is a couple of quick reasons why not to buy this game:
- There is A LOT of button delay when playing online. Passes will often take off a full 1.5-2 seconds after you've given the button imput.
- There is a clear and obvious cheating problem that, even after 5 YEARS of me playing this game on this platform, still has not been addressed.
- It is complete RNG whether or not you'll win an online match. It's almost as if the servers actively try to give you or your opponent an edge through 'passing errors' that the AI make.

There is nothing enjoyable about this game anymore. I for sure will not buy this game again, and I advise you not to either.
found_helpful: 2 people found this review helpful 0

content:
Posted: September 29
Obviously it's better than FIFA23.
They changed graphics a bit, added new cutscenes, new movement (cosmetics for me), several good functions both on player (like agent for example or pre-match training) and manager career (improved tactics, no training system). As long as I played, I'm happy with the changes made. However I haven't encountered any game-breaking bug yet, but I saw some coding problems and that's all. I like the product, but it's too overpriced. Many things are the same, so why do we have to pay more for getting small updates? Especially there's no longer FIFA licence, so they don't have to pay 150 milions for it (according to the Internet).



The game still lacks Polish commentary, the first update made it getting random fps drops while playing, despite the fact I got enough resources to play it at least on recommended requirements. I'll watch the game carefully as it seems to be a gem if we consider the previous version (s). I think, the game will be worth it if they fix the fps drops. Even people with NASA PCs complain about random fps drops while playing.

content:
Posted: September 29
I'll start by saying that i've only played Ulimate Team game mode and in my opinion they've totally RUINED it.
I'm not saying that bringing female cards to it is a bad thing but it totally fu*ks up the market and prices.
There's no more building your squad from the ground up (this was the case before also if you paid for fifa points).
I've played like 10 games and my team OVR is 86 as it was 91 in the end of FIFA 23. That shouldn't be possible in my opinion and it ruins the experience.

The gameplay itself is clunky and feels non responsive. Graphics aren't any better than in the last years release. I wasn't expecting huge changes but gameplay wise i think this is a step backwards. Goalkeepers are useless, they basically dodge shots. :D

It's not all bad though. I like the shortcuts they made for ultimate team so you can quickly go from sbc -> market etc.
Haven't tried yet but i believe that the manager mode is better than ever before but i mostly play (F)UT online.

I DO NOT RECOMMEND to buy this for full price. Before it was an advantage in FUT to start at launch but you get a good team instantly now so it doesnt hurt to wait for this to get a discount.

BTW menu music is AWFUL i had to mute it.

If i could i would refund this and skip the whole game this year but because i opened one pack in early access they wouldnt let me to refund the game.

AH AND I FORGOT, IF YOU ACCIDENTALLY ACTIVATE YOUR KEYBOARD YOU CANNOT SWITCH BACK TO CONTROLLER.

content:
Posted: October 26
Product refunded

"EA Sports FC 24" truly sets a new standard when it comes to graphics and presentation in the world of football gaming. The visual elements are incredibly impressive, and they manage to create an unparalleled sense of realism and immersion. You genuinely feel like you're part of a real football league, thanks to the meticulous attention to detail in player animations and stadium design.

However, speaking from a personal standpoint, the gameplay can be a bit of a mixed bag. The momentum/scripting system, while intriguing, sometimes feels capricious. It can be challenging to anticipate outcomes, and that unpredictability can occasionally be a source of frustration because you suddenly lose control of your player.

For example, in a match, if one team is significantly better than the other, the scripting mechanic may come into play to level the playing field. This could lead to the underdog team suddenly performing exceptionally well, while the stronger team might experience a dip in performance. In essence, it's an attempt to make games more exciting and less one-sided.

In conclusion, "EA Sports FC 24" offers an awe-inspiring visual experience for football enthusiasts. The game's attention to detail is truly commendable. On the flip side, the gameplay has not changed much from the last decade, particularly the impact of the momentum system, can be a bit perplexing at times, making the overall experience a bit of a rollercoaster.

Fix, your, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, game.

content:
Posted: September 29
Completely and utterly broken. Do not buy

Blatant match fixing has always been a problem in FIFA games, however its amped up 10x in this game. If you merely press B or Circle to tackle in the box, you will give away a penalty and you will have your defender be sent off. If you don't do this, the opposition score. Every time you do score a goal, the opposition will immediately score and you will not be able to do anything about it. The ball and attacking players will literally phase through your defenders if the game decides it wants you to lose.

As a Newcastle United fan, I obviously play as them a lot. Anthony Gordon, the fastest player in the Premier League is one of the slowest wingers I've ever used in a football game. Sven Botman STILL does not have his face in the game despite being one of the best players at a huge Premier League and Champions League club. Newcastle and Arsenal do not have their European number fonts in the game.

Using a controller is completely broken in this game, just as it was in FIFA 23. Half the time it will work, but the other half you won't even be playing the game. Your players won't move, or will run off in some random direction, completely out of your control. In the menus, you will try to navigate and either nothing will happen or you will flick through all options really fast when you are trying to do something. You literally can't change players when trying to defend. You can't pass or shoot or anything, you will just run off the pitch. You have to then press a button 50 times for it to register what you are doing, by which time the game has moved on.

Please, please, please do not buy the game. All of this is aside from the fact its literally the exact same game as every other year. Don't be as stupid as me, do not buy. Steam NEED to allow refunds for everyone who bought this complete scam of a game
found_helpful: 2 people found this review helpful 0

content:
Posted: September 29
I would love to offer a more in-depth review but I've been unable to get the game to go past the splash screen when you first boot it up and have since refunded. Seems to be an incompatibility issue with some of the latest AMD drivers, so not exactly an issue with the game itself. But whilst searching around for potential solutions to that problem, I was sadly seeing plenty of other issues that seemed to be present in the PC version, which led me to go for the refund in the end. Approach the PC version with caution, swing for the console version if you have one and still want to play. Of course, if PC is your only or preferred option, then you will have to make the value assessment on your own terms. I expect the AMD driver issue will be or already has been resolved. The other issues will be for EA to sort.

content:
Posted: October 19
This is the least realistic soccer game I have ever played in my life. If you don't care about the stats of the players and the speed of your defenders who are lost with every sprint and overhead ball, if you like how the opponent uses the kick off glitch and you lose a goal every time you resume from the middle, if you like how you win 5:0 and the opponent disconnects from the server and doesn't credit you with the victory, if you like to learn by heart how to use two buttons to attack, go down under the goal withdraw the ball and score this game is for you. If you think referees in real life are terrible it could be worse though. The developers who released this game should be ashamed that something like this saw the light of day and the bought reviews only reflect this perfectly. I think Pet Soccer is more realistic than this year's "Fifa". If it were possible I would want a refund because it is unplayable crap.

content:
Posted: October 3
I can say EA FC 24 is better than all FIFA games. The reason behind that idea is game play is better than all other FIFA's. Also optimization is better than FIFA 23. I don't have any fps drops with my RTX3050 mobile and I'm playing over 120 fps. Before buying this game i had questions on my mind. One of this questions is having women in FUT. Having women players whom has more strength and pace than men sounded awkward and i still think so. But having women in FUT made more playable players in FIFA and at the beginning of the game it really helps constructing teams. The new skills that players have is really OP, For example I have CR7 in my team, and he has a skill which makes him to shoot power shoots faster and accurate. It makes CR7 playable even though he is in Saudi Arabia. If you are interested in buying this game and have questions about optimization or thinking whether game play is different, I can easily tell that optimization is good, and game play is improved. But if you are interested in playing career mode only, it's not necessary to buy. If you're going to play online modes you should definitely buy.

content:
Posted: September 29
Excellent game. Great controls. The ultimate team mode is very fun. Ultimate team does have pay to win elements, but you can also play it casually. If the pay to win bothers you, there is also seasons mode in which you can play a team against other players online, and the game will track your progress. There are several other game modes as well : manager, club mode, and volta. Volta is interesting and I admit that I have not tried it yet. It is a street football mode in which you control one player online, and it tracks your progress. I am really excited to jump in that when I have the time.

I am new to FIFA video games (now just titled FC because of licensing). There is alot to learn! I don't mean rules, I already know those, I enjoy sports. There is a lot to learn in terms of button combinations, plays, positioning, and other game mechanics. I still have much room to grow, but am getting better each play. One downside the game has is the lack of tutorial. The tutorial is in a different game mode and will walk you through gameplay mechanics but it does leave a lot to be desired. Fortunately, if you are committed to getting better there are a ton of resources available online to improve your game.

They have added women into the game in several game modes. I think this is wonderful! You can play the most popular game mode, ultimate team, and have both male and female players on the same team. I LOVE IT! Women can now feel included, and that is what we all want right? This is a wonderful thing! I hear EA is doing that with other sports as well and that motivates me to try out those games. It isn't fully integrated yet. You can not play women's teams in managers mode. I did read an article that hinted it will be in future versions of this game.
