content:
Posted: September 30
When other people have problems launching and playing games, it almost never happens to me. I see all the negative reviews here, most of them are just the typical "EA bad" circlejerk, but some of them actually list real problems. I'll add on to that here with my experience with the game.


[1.] Game took 4 tries to launch in the first place. EA App keeps crashing.
[2.] When game actually does launch, it freezes on the first screen. Had to quit and relaunch again.
[3.] When I got past the first screen, I'm told to pick my club/league/etc. I can't move the thing to make any selections at all. I close and relaunch AGAIN.
[4.] Now my cursor moves! Oh wait, it's only moving in one direction and I can't go the other way at all. Close and relaunch...
[5.] Okay, cursor moves both directions, I can pick my league and whatnot. Now let's go make a player and start career mode! Oh the cursor broke again. Close and do research that shows this was a problem last year too. If you have a mouse and keyboard, which you probably do considering you're on a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ PC, it defaults to trying to use them in menus instead of JUST the controller. I tried just unplugging my m+kb to get around this, didn't help me.
[6.] Eventually make my way into making my character, I get him just how I want and get to the main screen. I had to leave the house right after, so I save and quit. When I came back to finally play the game..... my save data was gone. My settings are not saved, I'd have to remake my player again, etc.
[7.] Uninstall and refund because if it deleted my character right at the start, I am NOT ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ around with losing actual progress down the line.


So there you go. I'm really bummed as I was really looking forward to playing this one, I skipped last year in anticipation of the new game having a new name and was hoping it would be smoother than ever. That is certainly not the case. I wouldn't even bother if you value your time, if it doesn't break immediately, it'll probably break when it will hurt a lot more later down the line.

content:
Posted: October 4
I don't normally write reviews for games but honestly i have to say, I LOVE THIS GAME. It been the first fifa since 14 i have grinded and loved the gameplay. Not only have i been playing both single player career mode, manager career mode but i have also been grinding UT. It has been a very enjoyable exp so fair. I Preordered the game and was playing it for 7 days before public release and as you can see im well over 100 hours so far.

The game does has its flaws however

1. The defending is some of the hardest it has ever been
2. Running down the line and passing into the box is stupid OP and there seems to be no way to defend against it.
3. The mains are little laggy and there is a lot of button dely when in the mains themselves.

HOWEVER there are some really good positives to this game as well

1. The battle pass (or level system Objectives) give you a mega load of packs and really good rewards and i have to admit that it takes little to no effort to get up the lvs. You have Bi-weekly objectives where you can get 2000 xp for just playing 30 games in any game mode. You get daily xp as well which = up too 200xp a day. There is now 40 lvs for the battle pass and the rewards are really engaging as i have talked about above.
2. SQUAD BATTLES is now 4 minutes half's meaning that the whole match is 8 minutes long meaning it doesnt take that long to play each match.
3. THE EVOS are amazing, i know that one of them is 50k coins or 1000FC points but i promise getting 50k in this game is super easy as moment rewards are Tradable and so you can earn enough coins.
4. The playstyles and Playstyles + make are amazing and really make the game more fun as you start to prio them for each player meaning that you can really make some amazing teams. Picking each player that fits your playstyle.

I really am looking forward to what this game turns into over the course of the year but so far it has been extremely enjoyable. I really hope the Battle pass is just as enjoyable now when we get season 2 and the SBC's continue to being priced good and match the power curve of the game.

I would give this game 7/10 SO FAR

content:
Posted: October 1
To the developers of EAFC 24, PLEASE MAKE DEFENDING EASIER. You can accomplish this in two ways. First of all, reduce the computers attacking capability. They always do these broken kick the ball 10 yards ahead and then sprint to the ball, completely burning your defenders. It is also nearly impossible to win the ball back when the computer has possession. Tackling is really hard. In my past 10 games, I have conceded 1 goal in two of them, 2 goals in one of them, 3 goals in four of them, and 4 goals in three of them. On the other side, out of my past 10 games, I have won 9 and drawn 1 on world class difficulty. I hate having all of these high scoring games because it is so unrealistic and extremely frustrating defensively. Please fix your coding to reduce the computers attacking capabilities and increase the users defending capability, especially the user's computer. The defenders that you are not controlling on your team will literally let the computers attacker run through them. It is like they have a pact between each other. I have 2 more comments. 1, I have still not figured out how to move your goalkeeper on penalty kicks. I tried searching online and looking at the controls in the game, but no matter what buttons I smash, the goalkeeper does not move. He just stands still and does a standing dive like 2 feet to his left or right. Lastly, if the computer has a free kick within 5 yards of the penalty box, it is a 100% guaranteed goal. What is even more frustrating is I can see my goalkeeper holding a horrible position for the free kicks, but I can't do anything to change it. Also they haven't fixed near post goalkeeping. My goalkeeper will be glued to the near post and still somehow concede.

content:
Posted: October 5
I bought this game to cure boredom and full fledged expected to not enjoy too much. It exceeded my expectations although I think a different name would do more justice, hows about... George Floyd simulator... I know what you all are thinking, oh this dudes crazy, but no I am just coming off a string of div rivals losses due to the Simulator in question (I think this is a fair enough reason to justify this). If you want to feel like space is nonexistent and everyone is defending you with such ease be my guest and buy it to test that theory out. I genuinely am privileged to be this enlightened by EA for showing me how Derek's knee really felt. Really took being in someones boots to the next level except it was police issued boots not football boots. And I honestly think I am going insane over this game the analogies I have made on discord calls are the most whack ones yet and this was just an example of that.

I would recommend if you play a style where you just defend and defend then twist and turn like crazy then this game is for you. If you want to play good, realistic football where you have to pass to find space and you actually can play through the midfield better luck next year... I wonder what tragedy they are gonna strive replicate then, maybe Pearl Harbor would be a good baseline. (The only sentences that were not jokes were the two preceding the conclusion, but seriously if people could stop twisting my ♥♥♥♥ off with a fast winger I would appreciate it ;),

PS: (I am only mentally insane when playing this game)

content:
Posted: September 29
I like it.

It's my first Fifa/FC game that I've bought to actually play and I really like it.
Some things can be improved sure.

But I don't have any problems with performance or bugs really. There's the one bug with the mouse where you can switch in the menu with the controller, but you just need to move your mouse again and then it works... sure, it can be annoying but it's not game breaking.

I like that there are a lot of rewards to play for and aim for - and for me who's new it's cool to learn all the new things etc. and try everything out. I get that veteran players probably have deeper understanding and can better say what's bad.

Sometimes there can be weird things where you try to challenge/fight an opponent with the ball but it's feels like there's an invisible bubble around him and your player just dances around him - but that's maybe also because I'm still learning everything.

But for me, a new player, I like it so far.

content:
Posted: September 29
This game makes me feel hyped AF. P2W mechanics seem less egregious this year. Evolution's are sick. Gameplay feels very smooth. The addition of women is also a nice touch, and makes the game feel more fresh. Crossplay across all game modes is also awesome. Harry Kanes card is just about as unremarkable as he is. They truly have captured the essence of SOCCER. Electronic Arts Sports Football Club 2024 by Electronic Arts is a GOOD game, with a bad title.

content:
Posted: September 29
I know what EA do all the year long: Making another trailer for us and change the game from bad to worse . I have never played in a game with so many bugs - NEVER . I have a strong PC but my game is lagging as hell, I was forced to play 1080x720 res , to play normally. Worse and Worse every year . Servers are lagging , it just knock me off during the game from ultimate team - I am loosing the game + my reputation . Also cheaters . I played 3 Drafts ... 2 of them was lost to cheaters , the match is starting they are doing a pass and I am out from your servers , I gain a loose and I lost the draft and the cheat is so good that I do not gain a played draft match in the objectives . DO SOMETHING WITH YOUR SH!TTY GAME !!!!

Update: Controller is working very very bad , you can play 10 matches in a row np , but the next one it does not work in the game, it works in the menu, but not in the game and you can not do anything about it , you just have to quit the game and start a new one and guess what ? IT WORKS AGAIN !!! how, why , for what ? Optimize it for your players , you are on a good way to loose a lot of your clients ! You are doing good EA , if that is your goal.

UPDATE:
-It's 24.10 Mariah Carey started to sing "What I want for Christmas" and they still did not remove the kick of glitch on Fifa.
-The menu is still crushing when you are doing SBC/creating squads or buyng players .
- Ladies are stil OP .
-The " Y" or "trianlge" pass does not work in this game, you can remove the button from your gamepad .
-Ground pass are still sh1t , 1/2 passes are going to the wrong direction that you wanted to go and thinking that pasing with R1 will help- you are naive.
-Swiching players ? forget , the game will switch to the player the game wants , not the closest to the ball or the defender who can cover the ball
-Broken animation , where you can clearly see how the scrips work when a defender want to get the ball from you and usually ladies are glitching because of the 1.65 m heigh but defending better than Van Dijk.
-Very often super long distance curved/trivella goals - very realistic !

Looks like I am crying a lot on this one. Yeah it's because they ruined the game I love and it is imposible to play now without laughing how bad it is. I am not a newbie , I am also not a cyber microwave , I did 9 wins on WL(not great , not terrible) , I am a regular fifa player , have been in this game since 2005 and I am suffering because EA gives a ♥♥♥♥ on people like me and pay more attention to cyber microwaves who are playing the game 24/7 and learning all the glitches and donating money in this game, cause PAAAAACKS - are super exiting.
WORST FIFA GAME EVER , ohh it is not called FIFA anymore....thanks GOD !!!!

content:
Posted: October 14
Basically the same game as the year before but worse PC optimization, with time EA also couldnt care less about team licensing, which is why we lost some national teams and clubs. Just a few new gameplay changes like "Playstyles" (Similar to traits in FIFAs), precision passing... little additions but even more bugs, errors and such. The real joke is buying Ultimate Edition or even worse FIFA Points (Dont buy them, not worth it for any price) with many people not getting their Ultimate and Pre Order rewards and have to contact EA support to even get them. Decent game with a massive playerbase and sadly the best football game 8/10

content:
Posted: October 14
worst fifa (yes its exactly the same despite the name change) ever released.

FC 24 uses the exact same assets as the past 5 fifa games. Commentary voices, animations, customisation items, AI intelligence and much more are literally the exact same assets from FIFA 23/22/21/20 and even fifa 19.

This is standard for fifa, although despite using the same assets this is by far the buggiest one yet.

Frequent game crashes, infinite loading screens and plenty of game breaking bugs including invisible players.

As for game play... It's EXACTLY the same as every other fifa game just with updated squads and kits. The only noticeable changes is the menus and music.

Also the HUD is awful. In-game camera angle cuts the bottom of the pitch off, which is fine, but also the minimap fades to the point its basically not viewable or in some instances (free kicks) it will vanish completely, meaning if you're playing clubs you literally cannot see your player or what is around them.

Difficulty settings are unrealistic. On world class, every team plays like prime barca. On legendary, MK dons play like Barca whilst your 1bn value Man City squad have the ability of 50 rated players. Clubs AI also feel really good some games and then are terrible in others.

Only buy this game if you want to play online with friends using cross platform. If not, just buy an older fifa on sale and use mods to update the squads. Alternatively just wait for a sale and the bugs to be fixed.

content:
Posted: September 30
I played FIFA 94 up to 2019. But before 2019 it was disappointment after
disappointment. And stopt playing FIFA (any EA game for that matter)
So after 4-5 years how does the game hold up? My pro & cons.

PROS:
- It has been long overdue, but finally some costumization for own teams is back. Even though its limited, Its very welcome
- Limited stadium costumization
- the game looks okay
- I love football
- Menu's feel responsive
- I like the english commentary teams
- A few support chants are added in the game
- EA still have the licenses for the team and leagues

CONS:
- EA app needed
- 70€ not worht it
- Menu's are a mess. The game has many modes, settings, the menu system doesn't make the clutter any better.
- No commentary issue. I had to download english language pack on steam and then change my language ingame again to make commentary available. Also a brilliant move from EA to have audio for commentary off by default.
- Ultimate team: What a clutter of menu's. Let me play
- Ultimate team: Woman mixed with men? wtf.
- Not really expanded european football. It would benefit UEFA leagues in career
- Womans are in the game
- Volta is the game
- Ultimate Team is in the game
- GenZ braindeath music
- Career mode: Own team: can't choose players
- Career mode: Its basiscally the same career mode as 5 years ago, 10 years even. Only they added some training/coach training paths. It just a waste of time and it only clutter the menus even more with numbers and icons.
-pre-game intro is horrible: I like that tv broadcast experience. Now u see one player training or stepping out a bus. And a second later its kick-off. Were is the TV presentation. Presentation of the crowds, Atmosphere, player line ups are gone
- Everytime a player gets a card i get a POV of the referee. Why? I never saw this in real life.
- Gameplay: standard Time/scoreboard layout is really bad.
- Gameplay: When you score a goal or something the TV information is so fast i often can't read it
- Gameplay: is unbalanced attacking is to easy, defending to hard.
- Gameplay: They destroyed defending when they introduced "tactical defending" many years ago. It was never so bad. players just refuse to defend or tackle and rather want to run away. If the bal is "dead" and no team has posession. My player will refuse to pick up the ball.
- Gameplay: During a game they rather show all game faces of the goal scores intead of showing the names.
- Gameplay: Set pieces is just the same as last 10 years. The extra information were to hit the ball, and curved trajectory line can make it more easy now.
- The Generic stadiums are the same from 20 years ago. I don't see one new one.
- Career Match day: To change outfits you have to go trough multiple tabs for each game.


See you back in FC28-29

The game is awesome shortly. Graphics wise there is not much improvement from the latest addition of the serie, only improvements are some effects which make the game look very different. Gameplay wise the game feels a lot more realistic and enjoyable than the latest addition of the serie. Menus look worse than the latest addition of the serie, but they feel a lot faster and smoother. Overall the game is a 9 out of ten.

content:
Posted: September 29
Review:
I've been a fan of the FIFA series for years, and I have to say that FC24 has blown me away once again! This game is an absolute masterpiece in the world of sports gaming.

Graphics: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The graphics in FC24 are nothing short of stunning. The attention to detail in player faces, stadiums, and even the grass on the pitch is mind-blowing. It's like watching a real football match on TV.

Gameplay: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The gameplay in FC24 is incredibly realistic. The controls are intuitive, and the responsiveness is top-notch. Whether you're playing solo or with friends, every match is an adrenaline-packed experience.

Game Modes: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
FC24 offers a wide range of game modes to keep you entertained for hours. From Career Mode to Ultimate Team, there's something for everyone. The addition of Volta Football adds a refreshing street football experience to the mix.

Soundtrack: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The soundtrack in FC24 games is always on point, and FC24 is no exception. The music selection perfectly complements the gaming experience, and I often find myself humming the tunes even when I'm not playing.

Online Play: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The online multiplayer in FC24 is seamless. Playing against opponents from around the world adds an extra layer of excitement, and the matchmaking system ensures you face opponents of similar skill levels.

In conclusion, FC24 is the pinnacle of sports gaming. The combination of jaw-dropping graphics, realistic gameplay, and a variety of game modes make it a must-have for any football fan. EA Sports has outdone themselves once again, and I can't wait to see what they have in store for the next installment. This game gets a well-deserved 5 stars from me!

At first this is the 2nd best football game EA has done yet. (Beside FIFA 15 of course)

I've felt every difference for the last "FIFA" game, they really make a better hypermotion tech every year.

content:
Posted: September 29
FC 24 stands as a testament to the evolution of football video games, redefining the genre with unparalleled realism and an innovative approach that diverges from the conventional FIFA franchise. FC 24's impeccable attention to detail manifests in its breathtaking graphics, crafting a virtual football world that mirrors the beauty and intricacies of the sport itself. The enhanced player models, stadium designs, and meticulously crafted animations converge to create an immersive experience that borders on the surreal, blurring the lines between virtual and reality. FC 24's audacious departure from the FIFA formula is a breath of fresh air, introducing a unique gameplay style that is both challenging and rewarding, forcing players to adapt and learn new tactics, thus transcending the rote repetition that plagues the genre. Furthermore, FC 24 offers a cornucopia of play modes that cater to every football enthusiast, from the casual player seeking quick excitement to the hardcore strategist yearning for the ultimate managerial experience. In summation, FC 24 has succeeded in crafting an unparalleled football gaming experience that sets it apart as the definitive choice for aficionados seeking an extraordinary amalgamation of improved graphics, innovative gameplay, and unbridled fun. One more thing, Come On You Gunners!

content:
Posted: September 30
Game runs great even my EVGA 1070 FTW at 1080p. It recognizes my PS5 Dual Sense controller with no uses (Make sure to disable Steam Input).

As for those already complaining about the DRM Denuvo and other security measures, I think it's for the best that those are in place to prevent hacks and other tooling that some bad actors may want to use to ruin the experience during the lifespan of the game. After it's one year cycle, as a publisher/developer I would removed and let the community, hackers, modders, etc do with it whatever they please since this is a yearly produced product that will lose it's importance each year anyways (No, this is not 1994 were you would get revisions for FIFA hopefully and have to re-purchased the cartridges if you even knew which revision it was, welcome to the year 2024 - stop complaining and asking for the old days, go spend over $80+ at Six Flags or move on sir).

For those on Linux (including Steam Deck), I'll fiddle around with it at the proton level and provide feedback to the github repository from my findings since it currently does not run on Linux. Hopefully it doesnt end up like FIFA 2023 were it stayed borked for it's whole cycle..

content:
Posted: October 1
EA FC 24 - Pushing the Boundaries of Virtual Football

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

EA FC 24 builds upon the solid foundation laid by its predecessor, FIFA 23, offering both familiar gameplay mechanics and exciting new features. Here's what stands out:

Gameplay (4.5/5): The core gameplay mechanics have been refined to offer a more realistic and engaging football experience. Player movements, ball physics, and AI behavior are noticeably improved, creating a more authentic on-field feel. The tactical options have been expanded, allowing for greater control over team strategies.

Graphics and Presentation (4.5/5): The visuals in EA FC 24 are stunning, showcasing a level of detail that further blurs the line between virtual and reality. Player likenesses, stadium environments, and weather effects contribute to a truly immersive experience. The crowd animations and reactions add an extra layer of realism to the matches.

Modes and Features (4/5): The game offers a plethora of modes to keep players engaged. Career Mode sees welcome improvements, with more depth in player development and team management. Ultimate Team continues to be a standout, providing an addictive card-collecting experience. The inclusion of new challenges and events keeps the game fresh.

Online Play (4/5): The online component of EA FC 24 remains a strong point, with smooth matchmaking and a vibrant community. The addition of dedicated servers has significantly improved the online experience, reducing lag and ensuring more fluid matches.

Innovation (4/5): While EA FC 24 doesn't revolutionize the series, it introduces subtle yet impactful innovations. The introduction of new skill moves, refined set pieces, and enhanced player interactions contribute to a more dynamic and unpredictable gameplay.

Commentary and Soundtrack (3.5/5): Commentary remains competent, providing insightful analysis and capturing the excitement of the matches. The soundtrack offers a diverse selection of tracks, although personal preferences may vary.

In summary, EA FC 24 represents a commendable step forward for the FIFA series. It successfully refines existing elements while introducing subtle innovations to enhance the overall experience. With its impressive visuals, engaging gameplay, and a wealth of modes, it's a must-play for football enthusiasts and FIFA fans alike. While there's room for improvement in certain areas, it remains a strong contender in the sports gaming genre.

content:
Posted: November 8
To start: i don't recommend the game. It's riddled with bugs not only in the gameplay, but there's a lot of visual bugs in the UI. The UI also makes no sense and is just a clutter.

Microtransactions are back in full force, and EA are shoving out untradeable packs in the shop. Not only do they want to sell you digital goods that are worthless in a year, but they also want to sell you digital goods that might be useless immediately as you pack them.

Ultimate team gets most of EAs little attention and the other game modes are usually left in the dust. The only positive part about this iteration is improvements to pro clubs and a few for player career. Bugs takes way too long to fix.

The gameplay feels sluggish and non responsive. While this matter is highy subjective, it is in my opinion the worst FIFA/EAFC ever made regarding gameplay.

Conclusion:
The game is really bad, and EA keeps pushing the microtransactions they make billions off with barely any of the money going back in to the game to make it better. The game is riddled with bugs and it takes forever to fix them, if they ever get fixed at all. It just screams lazy, and it's unacceptable that a multi billionaire company such as EA can churn out this garbage with no effort each year.

content:
Posted: November 7
First month and a half had 0 complaints, gameplay felt good, loved the introduction of playstyles, and online games felt responsive and smooth. Fast forward to present day, and the game has become literally unplayable for me for the past week and a half. Gameplay is so sluggish, my players are unresponsive (literally run the opposite way when I'm in control of them), and it's absurd. I keep logging in each day hoping its improved, and its always the same thing. I have a gig connection, have been monitoring my frames which have not dropped at all, and the result is still the same, I don't even know what to blame at this point, but in this current state I have no wish to play if it'll continue like this. Should've never made the switch from console to PC because I never had this issue so consistently on PS5.

content:
Posted: November 7
One step forward, 100 steps back. I only play Player Career and it's been just sad. Match Rating is completely broken and Season Objectives are outlandish (Take a League Two club to Championship? Best we can do is 10k per wk only if you get 30 assists). This wouldn't be an issue but I run sliders to keep things as close to realistic as possible bc winning 10-0 every match is boring. If you don't meet your Season Objectives, you can't even resign with the club and are forced to move on as a 87 OVR when the rest of the squad only has 68 at most. Player Career was supposed to be a means to "play your own way" and it's become more of a chore. This will be my last FC game until they actually fix things. Just not worth it anymore.

content:
Posted: November 4
While FIFA 24 brings some incremental improvements to the table, it falls somewhat short of being a significant leap from its predecessor, FIFA 23. In the career mode, you'll find a limited number of new cutscenes, with a maximum of 10, which might leave you wanting more. Additionally, in the Ultimate Team mode, there's a curious inclusion of troll packs featuring women, which could leave some players questioning their value, especially considering the 70 euro price tag.

content:
Posted: November 4
I've been playing football games and Fifa since 90's.

This years FC24 edition seems different from previous ones because of one noticeable issue. Gameplay is decent but performed actions, passes, shots, tackles etc seem to be much more clunky than before. Also the DDA seems to kick in way harder. I feel really bad scoring 2-0 in very early match, it feels like it's always going to end something like 3-6 when DDA gives the boost for opponent. Yep, my tin foil hat is on.

I believe "clunkiness" is part of DDA and game constantly determines, for example, wether a pass should be delivered to own player or to opponent. This causes unsatisfying interceptions and also "wow I didn't actually try and/or deserve this"-feeling when sometimes DDA kicks in for me and unbelievable pass completes. Game this year is lacking the satisfying feeling that you've played well or built a good attack. Don't really need to meantion winger+cutback methods...

Is there DDA in competitive multiplayer matches and why would EA make it so?

- Money. More even the matches are, winning or losing, more money people spend on average. Equal matches make people keep playing and want to improve their teams. Huge losses cause players to quit the game and they are worth 0$ to EA. This is nothing new, online gaming has even patented ways to make online matches artificially even and giving players feeling that they should spend money.

In corporate point of view, it would be very stupid to not optimize matches as equal as possible, giving players good feelings and incentive to spend money to FC Points. No board of directors in company this big will ever say "it's ok let players play fair and let's take whatever they want to spend". No way. Any such director would be fired on spot. They optimize the player experience if they are even remotely smart.

In players point of view, this of course is very disrespectful and scummy behaviour.

So why this year passes and gameplay feels unsatisfying and clunky? I believe it's the same reason as poor quality of menus, bugs and UI crap. They are doing the minimum they can get away with. Same logic goes to gameplay and DDA especially. Of course it would be possible to use DDA so discreetly or smoothly that players don't notice it, but it would take way much more work, causing metric tons of expenses. Not really what EA does in other fronts, they want to spend the minimum.

Solution? Maybe call them out for DDA. Ask for fair matches. Ask for fair pricing models. Vote for loot box bans in your countries. Any other ideas? Share them in comments!

Ps. I don't care how many wins I get in WL. I just want fair matches, even endin 0-0 or 0-1. I want decent quality product and fair monitization. I want to be relegated in divisions, finding my own skill level and working my skills from there.

PROS:

fun when playing with a friend

the only thing that is fun in this game is the pack opening and the SBC, the rest is meaningless or boring.

content:
Posted: November 2
The game outside of UT is perfectly fine, besides the changes made to the training grounds.
Ultimate Team is now even more P2W than it has been any other year. From the very start the big big packs that we wouldn't see till Toty are out in week 1. The meta from Fifa23 carried over making the first few weeks basically unplayable for those that just chill and play for fun. After that it changed to 71 depth, 424/442/4231/442(2)/4222, with pressure after possession lost. This still has not been changed even after 5 or so weeks. The new Evolutions are a great concept but have been poorly executed. Within the first batch of Evos they made 78 Ansu Fati into an 84/85 that was a very cheap replacement for Mbappe with better links. Since then the evolutions have been not so game breaking until this last one where you can make Llorente even better. The DDA still rules supreme and sways matches away from the actually good to cater towards those that are worse. In previous years it was noticeable but not all that drastic to where a game would be decided on who had DDA in their favor. Not in EAFC24 though. In 24 the DDA decides matches unless you can somehow just be that much better. The best players will feel so much worse when DDA kicks in. Mbappe will feel like 78 pace, VVD will feel like a bronze, Courtious would be better replaced with the 1 arm woman. DDA is that bad in UT.

content:
Posted: October 30
Bang Average!
i have been playing fifa since the past 15 years, but this year has to be amongst the top 3 worst FIFA'S of all time
1. The game is poorly optimized for PC. i switched to PC over the last year and this is my first FIFA on PC, boy oh boy it is awful. I have spent so much time just to get this game to a playable state ( I have a more than powerful PC for this game)
2. The DDA/ scripting seems to be getting out of hand this year, some games your players are good and the next they feel like bronze players.
3. The gameplay is very poor, feels like the engine isnt optimized properly - the ball keeps on bouncing back to opponent after tackling,
Conclusion: My love for football keeps me returning to FIFA because its the best football game out there, but hopefully next year we get a better football game from other developers.

content:
Posted: October 28
Purchased the game strictly to play Pro Clubs and while I'm aware I haven't mastered all the (new) mechanics of the game (since my last FIFA was FIFA 14)... the game is absolutely horrific.
Riddled with bugs, extremely clunky and incredibly infuriating in certain scenarios.
There's pro's and con's to this game...but it as of right now (28/10/2023) it feels like an alpha title...not even a beta release.
---
There is a new "training" feature in pro clubs - allowing you to get up to 4000XP every week. Sounds great right? Except, once you complete the training session - the UI bugs out and the only way out of it is to force shut down the game and re-launch. 10/10.
---
The passing has all gone to crap. Forget about through balls in 90% of the situations. AI's also don't know how to through ball with majority of the balls getting intercepted by the opponent's AI.
You used to be able to use skill moves to get past AI opponents - not anymore. The guy will cover and jockey you the entire time until you take a slightly heavier touch and lose possession. The only time skill moves work on AI's is when they bug out and miss a tackle.
Set pieces (Free kicks, corners) are absolutely horrendous. The good old days when you had to use pure intuition and skill to score? Gone. Replaced with an awful "guided aim" where you have to select your curve and direction. 2.9 of a bar? Well - sorry champ, the ball drops down to knee level of the keeper. 3.0 and above? Oh, well good luck saving it!
---
The balancing between tackling and issuing commands to AI is passable at best. When you're instructing the AI to clear the ball (Press B or O), half the time you end up tackling the air yourself - and if you're unfortunate enough you give away penalties or free kicks. Outstanding!
---
As for the experience with online players? Funnily enough it's greatly improved since I last played a FIFA title - with the exception of a few, my experience has been as an overall positive.
I prefer the new system where you have to invest points in your skills (shot power, passing etc.) - but with the passing so bad, I found that there's little to no point investing your points in that skill tree.
---
There's potential for this game, but the rate at which bugs are fixed and patches are released right now is anything but Agile DevOps. I feel like this game was left with a skeleton crew to support the release and moved on the the "EA FC 25" title; where majority of bugs are still probably going to prevail and they'll sell you a new ground-breaking feature that nobody uses and everyone skips through.
.
Don't buy this pile of crap right now unless you're into masochism.

content:
Posted: October 27
Hey, I'm a pretty casual FIFA, or I guess now its FC24 but a very casual player none the less. The FIFA I've been playing for a long time now was FIFA17, great game, still play it a bunch. I thought to myself, it's been 6 years, might as well try a new one. So i picked up this. There are some new features I didn't have in 17 so I had some fun messing around with the newer features and everything like that. been playing for about 24 hours as of writing this. And I can confidently say I'm having a good time! yeah sometimes it makes me want to throw my controller in an active volcano, but that's just FIFA. There are bugs here and there still, but most of them aren't really game changing and I've mainly laughed when I've gotten them since most of them in my experience are just silly glitches. Some thoughts though if you want a pros and cons list:

Pros:
-Some new ♥♥♥♥ was added, hooray
-New soundtrack is pretty awesome, I enjoy FIFA17s more though
-Okay career mode, I do miss the actual career with the VA and stuff though

Cons:
-Some bugs here and there, not that big of a deal though
-Ai can be pretty goofy sometimes, can get annoying

Final Thoughts:
Hey, listen, if you haven't picked up a new game in a while, give this one a try, you can always refund it! (Just make sure you haven't played for over 2 hours unless a really nice steam employee gives mercy upon your soul) I haven't ventured to online yet, so I'd look to other reviewers for that. All in all, I like the game from a casual perspective. Hope this helps and have a good day!

I highly recommend not getting the game.

content:
Posted: October 24
i wasn't going to buy this game this year, would have been the first fifa i hadn't owned since before it was even called fifa back in 88, i hate the fact women have been added to FUT, not because they don't deserve it, but the opposite they deserve there own, its getting so unrealistic its a joke, the womens and mens game are completely different, and when i see women players being rated higher than Kane, or CM's the same rating as De Bruyne its just not fair or funny.
however some of the much needed changes to career mode intised me into giving EA one last chance before i give up completely, i love career mode, pro clubs and manager mode (manager the most) and they have been neglected for years now so ea can focus on the cash cow that is FUT and i do enjoy FUT but the amount of games needed to keep up for none micro transaction players is a joke, however i will concede that FUT has been much fairer the last 3 years.
Graphical pleasing, cut scenes thumbs up and ok balanced game play.

content:
Posted: October 22
This possibly has to be the worst Fifa ever made. Compared to this FIFA23 feels like a GotY!

1. Horrible Input Lags and Delays. Random crashes and Menu bugs reported by thousands of players.

2. The gameplay is absolute trash. The defenders don't defend, attackers don't move or make any runs at all.
Goalkeepers are probably the worst ever, if you charge the keeper he will 10000% miss the ball, one skill move and keeper is rendered useless, people will score against you far post goals at 180° and sometimes even near post.

If you're looking to play fifa I would recommend getting fifa23 and skip this year altogether.

content:
Posted: October 22
TL;DR Online modes are rinse-and-repeat of previous installations. Too many bugs/recycles that cause soft locks or diminish overall experience during career mode. Most of the new mechanics are either inconsequential or contribute to the issues plaguing career modes...
.
.
First things first, the parts of this game that function are nothing too special. FUT and Volta are decent but only because EA can dig deeper into consumers' pockets with these modes. Haven't had a chance to try out Pro Clubs or any online friendlies since my friends respect their time and money but nothing seems changed about these modes at face value.

The vast majority of problems are in career mode. The new coaching system on manager career soft locks when you go to fire a coach. Player career contract is hit or miss whether it'll actually allow you to renew or force you to settle for signing somewhere else. The required and optional objectives for contract negotiation are a welcome addition if they actually worked... Tackling rate contract objective doesn't seem to track correctly if your player doesn't take on any defensive duels to update the state beyond 0%. And the continued existence of the team possession match objective is pretty lame. Why should I be punished if the opponent AI is playing it safe with possession or my own team's AI doesn't properly mark or clear in a meaningful way to reestablish possession?

But if I want to nitpick the lack of UX consideration on EA's part a little more, I'd say the completely unchanged pool of press conference dialogues and news articles is still a big thumbs down even with a few new cutscenes for Player of the Season, Ballon d'Or, and winning leagues/cups. Is there a shortage of creative talent in Canada and Romania I don't know about that means this game has to keep all text-based interaction at a 2nd grade reading level?

And lastly, the new mechanics just don't feel impactful in a good way. PlayStyles feel like nothing more than traits under a different name. The manager career coaching helps keep players in-form but it would be nice to be able to fire a 2- or 3-star coach for a 5-star without the game freezing up. It would also be nice to experience contract negotiation as a player in a similar manner to the manager career counterpart... "Signing" a 1-year each season doesn't feel as authentic as being offered a long-term contract or putting a release clause in your own contract during negotiation. Plus what good does a contract system do when certain teams flatout refuse to sign you for not making enough sliding tackles as a CM or CAM?

I've been picking up FIFA almost every year since 2011 and I genuinely hope EA can address the issues with their undercooked rebrand from FIFA to EA FC. Unfortunately it's more likely that they'll find a way to butcher the series just like Sim City and the Sims. Alright, meandering review turned rant is over. To the readers, thank you for your time and I hope your eyes meet my vitriol again the next time I have another first-world-problem conniption over some EA shenanigans.

content:
Posted: October 21
Concerning all Player Vs CPU Modes/Gameplay: An assortment of laughably incomplete and half-baked ideas that are currently implemented much better in other sports games regardless of type or year of release. I could post this exact same review for the last 10 FIFAs/EAFC Titles. Again, only concerning PvCPU, there is nothing fun, challenging, dynamic, authentic, or with depth about this title, or the last 10 for that matter. Fundamental flaws have existed - by choice and arrogance - for nearing two decades, and simple QOL bugs still exist that can be spotted and fixed in a weekend by a novice Bethesda RPG Modding hobbyist. Sprinkled here and there with some useless annual aesthetic/ambiance additions and you get the yearly release of EAFC's Singleplayer experience.

content:
Posted: October 20
This is the first EA Fifa/FC game I bought at release. I had picked up FIFA 23 during the world cup sale for half off and it was fun so I tried this.

Ultimate team is basically just a pile of FOMO and the worst micro-transaction tactics imaginable. I got 30 hours out of it with my pre-order points and since I don't want to play hours everyday and grind or spend more money that mode will just move past me.

The rest of the modes are ageing and abandoned.

Is the core game fun? Yes, will I get my moneys worth out of this year? Yes

But I'm down voting it on the principle of its business model and the fact that they will try and do it again next year.

content:
Posted: October 17
FIFA 24 (FC 24) Game Review: Is It Worth the Upgrade From FIFA 23?

Introduction:
FIFA 24 (FC 24) is here, and if you're a die-hard football fan with over 20 hours in FIFA 24 (FC 24) and 400 hours in FIFA 23, you might be wondering whether it's worth the investment. In this review, we'll break down the good and bad aspects of the game to help you decide whether or not to buy it.

The Good:

Realistic Graphics and Animations:
FIFA 24 (FC 24) continues to impress with its lifelike player models, stadium details, and crowd animations. The game's visual quality remains top-notch, enhancing the overall immersive experience.

Enhanced Gameplay Mechanics:
FIFA 24 (FC 24) introduces improved ball physics, more precise player control, and better AI decision-making. These changes make for more realistic and enjoyable matches, especially in one-on-one situations.

New Game Modes:
The addition of exciting game modes like "Street Football" and "Custom League" offers diverse ways to enjoy the game beyond traditional matches, providing hours of entertainment.

Authentic Soundtrack:
FIFA games are known for their soundtracks, and FIFA 24 (FC 24) is no exception. The music enhances the overall gaming atmosphere and keeps you pumped throughout your gaming sessions.

Ultimate Team Enhancements:
If you're into FIFA's Ultimate Team mode, you'll appreciate the enhanced features, including new player chemistry dynamics and fresh challenges.

The Bad:

Microtransactions:
FIFA 24 (FC 24), like previous editions, heavily relies on microtransactions. While you can earn in-game currency by playing, the grind can be frustrating, and the temptation to spend real money remains a concern.

Minor Bugs and Glitches:
No game is perfect, and FIFA 24 (FC 24) has its share of bugs and glitches, which can be frustrating, especially in online matches. Some issues may impact the overall experience.

Limited Innovations:
While FIFA 24 (FC 24) makes incremental improvements, some players might feel that the changes are not groundbreaking compared to FIFA 23. It can make the upgrade seem less essential for some gamers.

AI and Referee Issues:
Occasionally, the AI and referee decisions can be questionable, leading to frustrating moments that feel out of your control.

Conclusion:

Should you buy FIFA 24 (FC 24) with over 20 hours in FIFA 24 (FC 24) and 400 hours in FIFA 23? It depends on your priorities. If you're a dedicated FIFA fan who enjoys the updated graphics, refined gameplay, and new game modes, FIFA 24 (FC 24) could be a worthwhile investment. However, if you're content with FIFA 23 and find the microtransactions and minor bugs off-putting, you might consider waiting for further improvements in future editions.

In the end, FIFA 24 (FC 24) is a solid entry in the series, but whether it's worth the purchase largely depends on your personal preferences and how much you want to stay on the cutting edge of virtual football.

content:
Posted: October 17
Gameplay - 2/10
Can't understand how a game that is suppose to be a football simulator have the most arcade gameplay i've ever tried, every game is a goal fest, it doesn't matter if you play against AI or against other players, the score will always be 7-4, 5-2, 10-1 etc...
Another big problem about is just how unrealistic the players move, look like they are doing ice skatting in the field... and players with 190cm and 80kg move with the agility of a ninja...

If you looking for PvP only attacking football with defense and midfield being useless this is your game... if you like a little career gameplay it's unplayable as the roleplay will be horrendous as every match is just unrealistic.

Graphics- 6/10
Graphics are good, maybe the strongest asset in the game, ambientacion looks awesome but the player models could be better.

Audio- 7/10
Nice soundtrack as always for a EA football game.

Difficult- 5/10
Game isn't difficult, just the defenses AI is just one of the worst ever... They don't react and attackers are too overpowered and unrealistic fast compared to defenders. Game needs to have a new control system to defend and make it actually fun and useful.

Grind- 1/10

content:
Posted: October 16
I have been playing FIFA/EAFC on and off since the early naughties and this is probably one of, if not, the glitchiest release to date.

I have only really ever been interested in the career mode aspect of FIFA and tend to usually play football manager as it is more realistic. I knew this would have been a more arcade experience but golly gosh. Playing as Celtic in the English League Two (just to learn the game) I was sacked for not qualifying for the last 16 of the champions league (I wasn't in it) and also for failing an objective to sign 2 players of different nationality to the club? I signed 8 non Scottish players, 7 players that weren't English just in case that counted. Nope apparently every player is from Scotland in this game.

The last FIFA I played regularly was probably FIFA 12 and yes, graphics and gameplay are much much better in this addition, however, I cannot help but feel that progress since has been underwhelming.

In summary, poor game and would expect more for the money, I'd just wait for FM24 to be released this week if I were you tbh

content:
Posted: October 15
First "Fifa" game I have bought in 5 years because of stale and minimal yearly improvements.
Last "Fifa" game I will buy for at least 5 years because of awful player experience and awful UI.

The definition of bad game design is penalizing the player through absolutely no fault of their own, this game does it in spades. For example turning up the difficulty makes your own players play like they have never played a game of football in their life, even though they are 86-90 rated, literally to the point they cannot make simple passes or even your 6ft4" defender with tons of defending playstyles not even being able to jump for a header against a 5"4 player with 50 strength.

Then there are the all to frequent "super human" moments where players act like they are literally superhuman, like taking the ball off you from 1 meter or further behind you, turning into Dhalsim stretching and contorting their legs to impossible angles to tackle you after they have already passed you, pinging the ball around like its a projectile and controlling it first time like they have super glue on their boots. The difficulty is also artificially increased by making successful tackles useless as the opposing player gets to keep the ball or insta-tackles you back, usually leaving you out of position and worse off than what you were.

There is also the issue of being dropped from squad battle games after the final whistle where you have won, saying the servers cannot process your request, you then get booted to the main menu and on re-entering ultimate team you are given a 3-0 loss, even though you never once lost connection to the internet or even the game, absolute joke.

The game is literally just an exercise in frustration through bad game design.

UI is just as bad, pray to god you never have to use the transfer market much, search for players with a max buy it now of 23k, says there is none, bump it up to 23.5k, shows hundreds at 23k.
Find a one cheaper and literally 99 times out of 100 it is already sold but wont tell you until you try to buy it, even refreshing the search will show the exact same card again, showing as unsold until you try and buy it again.

You would think that after 3 decades a multi-billion dollar company like EA would have their ♥♥♥♥ together by now but how wrong you would be, they have clearly stopped trying to make the game better for the players and solely focus on how to part you from as much money as possible.

content:
Posted: October 15
I want to start by saying i've never written a negative review about a Fifa game so don't take this review lightly.

This is why FC24 is the unplayable, genuinely the worst Fifa i've ever played.

- Cannot pass without AI intercepting although your own AI will not intercept passes.
- Tackles are broken, when you win a tackle, you cannot control your player briefly and the AI picks up the loose ball.
- Player switching is broken, it assigns the worst positioned player when switching.
- Stoppage time broken, i cannot tell you how many goals i've conceded in the 96th minute despite there only being 2mins added time, the game AI WILL score 3 or 4 mins passed the allotted added time because it is scripted.
- Pace means nothing.
- GK rebounds are awful.
- In career mode you cannot switch out injured, suspended or player in international duty without creating a new tactic.
- Loaned in players getting upset because i won't give them a new contract.

This really is a poor game but EA won't care because they're still making money.

content:
Posted: October 14
This is my first review on steam.
I’ve played every FIFA game for about 20 years.

This is the most unrealistic imitation of football in a computer game we have ever seen.

You will see players feet static but them
Skating along the surface of the pitch.

Feet and hands clipping through peoples bodies and the ball.

The ball teleporting into bizarre locations to match the animations of the players.

The players feet and bodies twisting and manipulating themselves into disgusting contortions.

The ball physics are bizarre you can absolutely leather your foot through a ball and it will trickle through your keepers arms, a header at the edge of the box will bullet at unimaginable speed into the back of the net from a soft cross.

It’s an utter utter shambles.

content:
Posted: October 14
EA FC 24 - A Descent into the Abyss of Despair

If you're searching for a soul-crushing, mind-numbing experience that will leave you questioning the meaning of life, look no further than EA FC 24. Prepare to be plunged into the darkest depths of despair:

Crippling Gameplay: The gameplay is like an eternal torment. Players move in erratic, glitchy ways. Controls are a baffling labyrinth, leading to nothing but frustration and anguish.

Surrealism Gone Mad: Realism is thrown out the window as players engage in absurd antics, performing feats that defy the laws of physics and common sense. It's a cruel distortion of the beautiful game.

Endless Empty Modes: The game offers a vast array of empty, hollow game modes that promise nothing but the gnawing emptiness of a life devoid of meaning.

Updates from the Abyss: EA's idea of updates is to plunge the game further into the abyss, making it even more agonizing with each "improvement."

content:
Posted: October 14
This game is absolutely horrible. How they managed to make a game worse than fifa 23, I have no idea.

Firstly, lets start with the menus, the biggest change. It is obvious to see why they do not make big changes like this ever, it is riddled with glitches and bugs that they could not fix in 3, you heard that right, THREE title updates. Which means now and again you have to restart your game because the menu broke.

Next is the gameplay, are you used to the bouncy balloon ass ball gameplay of FIFA? It is here on sterioids, you cannot make clean tackles, the ball bounces around like a yoyo and the opponent always seems to have the ball after.

There is also the AI press that everyone is running, goodluck playing through the middle in this game, everyone results to running down the line and cutting across since they have no other options.

Oh and the keepers? Yeah they might show passion but dont except them to act like they have played a PRO game in their lives. An issue also not fixed in THREE patches. good ♥♥♥♥ EA

There is also the issue with the refs, do not make a tackle in the box or you are getting sent off for sure. They give red cards for the most stupid reasons and the opponent still gets a pen.

Where did all the money saved from the FIFA license go? How can they cut a huge cost and the players see no benefit? This game is frankly insulting as a product. The SBCs released while good are incredibly expensive for FTP players, so guess what there is an 82+ x whatever in the store for you to buy, ♥♥♥♥ the 70/100 USD you already paid.

Pack weight is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ awful, they added a double walkout animation to sate the gamblers who are addicted to packs while the gameplay is in the worst state it has ever been.

Do NOT buy this game, maybe wait for a sale, wait for a patch next march that will finally make the game playable.

content:
Posted: October 14
Worst fifa I have played. The defending is atrocious, if the opposing player gets into the box, its basically a goal. Has been dead content in the first few weeks. No good sbcs or objectives, just rivals. The rebounds are back and worse than last years fifa. I can't tackle a player without losing the ball instantly because the ball bounces on the defenders leg and then returns to your opponent. And the goalkeepers. Oh my ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ god, the goalkeepers in this game is the worst I have seen in my life. When I tell the goalkeeper to move forward to approach the opposing player so he has less chance of scoring a goal, he runs left of the ball so the opponent has a open goal to score. Every shot on goal goes in, probably 1/5 of the shots on target gets saved. In my experience (playing with 89 rated Ter Stegen btw) my goalkeeper rarely gets a rating above 5.0 and if you don't know, that's a horrible rating. And that's not a rare occurence, that's every game. If you can't trust a 89 rated keeper to save a simple shot, then what's the point of the ratings? Might as well have a 55 rated bronze goalkeeper stand in goal if he is just going to let every shot go into the net.

content:
Posted: October 13
Having played the previous games for many years.

This feels like a step in the right direction. While I have had no issues on PC at present, the game still feels a bit behind the console versions in terms of gameplay and graphical fidelity.

Gameplay feels very similar to Fifa 23 with some obvious changes, such as slight animation changes and better response in controls. Goalkeepers still suck and Ultimate Team is a Rip off.
Season mode is going in the right direction, but I really don't understand how they can add so little in terms of improvements in the game year on year out.

They could easily add all the stadiums from the English leagues / French / Spain / Germany instead of having these random no name stadiums. Perhaps even if you choose the stadiums to have in the league to make it
more immersive ? Story mode should never have been abandoned. Instead Player Career mode should have played similar to that game mode from Fifa's old.

Co-op has been improved in ultimate team.
Same stupid system in Ultimate team. All the packs are still overpriced and takes way to long to save up credits to buy anything decent. Its a £70 game could at least give players some starting fifa coins and credits to help with the whales and over spenders in that mode, but I digress.

Overall its an improved FIFA 23. EAFC 24 should have just been called EA FC since its the first in the series. Fifa have confirmed they are making their own football game so hopefully that will be better than this.

There really is not any other choice in football games on the market. UFL is taking forever to come out and I am fed up of waiting for it. I might switch over to that when it comes out at some point in 2024 / 2025.

Its an average football game. The career mode is fun and Ultimate team is an abomination.
Buy it on sale.
This was a birthday present from my daughter otherwise I wouldn't have bothered.

Lets hope we get a better Football game in the future so I can finally player a career mode in something else. Ha.

*EDIT*

Update.

So after playing a while, the game frequently crashes or hangs in menus for no reason. Completely freezes up. The game does not even trigger "Not responding" instead it just keeps consuming memory and CPU.

The game would randomly stutter or freeze on the pitch as well during matches. I am having to manually shut the game down so I can re-load it back up to carry on playing. This happens every 20 - 30 mins. It is extremely frustrating. Which is now I wont recommend this game to anyone until they fix this mess of a game.

PC version is so under cooked and bad compared to the console counter parts.
I dunno why I expected better. Just another mess from EA with a little more paint than usual.
Bit of a joke to be honest. I can't wait until there is a game that rivals this game so I can play that instead.

content:
Posted: October 12
For a company which stated that it will be 'new' and 'innovative' game-play is a total lie, the gameplay is probably in its worst state in years. The game overall is clunky and mechanically all over the place, you have some of the fastest players in the game getting over-taken by people with much less pace, you got strong CB's getting man handled by small midfielders and wingers and keepers who are basically non-existent. The game is totally pay-to-win, it is embarrassing that you charge over 100$ for a game which has such a heavy pay-to-win method, literally there has been more store packs then content releases. Releasing 100K+ packs within the first few weeks just ruins the whole marketplace and shows clearly the difference between EA and the community, they do not care about the health of the population and the enjoyment of the players, the only thing they care about is providing store packs with the big what if when you see "Guaranteed 85+ for two and 31 rare golds", this cripples the market compared to 5-6 years ago and just makes the game not fun, playing against the same old constant meta-teams with the same tactics and same game-play, rely on auto-defending from AI / AI charge defending, AI press and then getting to the byline and then just cutting it back in for a tap in. For a competitive game, the best rewards should be won via winning games of champs, not loading up EAFC points and going to the store. It is sad because there aren't any alternatives out there similar to FIFA with the same quality and history, the day that company comes and does better, maybe then EA might actually listen to the community and put some good changes in for the community. Rather just attempt to milk its player-base every single year with 120$ for early access, and then countless amounts of store packs in promotion periods, baiting players to gamble rather then rewarding the better players

content:
Posted: October 12
its my own fault for buying another ea game.
its really FIFA 23 re-released. The gameplay feels the same and their "big new feature" in coaches and tactical styles is a simplified version of tactics that you could already apply in previous games.

The bugs are plentiful and frequent, I've had issues ranging from completely invisible players, players not locking onto the ball and running around it, and horrible misplaced free kicks (i was fouled outside of opp box and i was given the free kick for my keeper in front of my box

As primarily a career mode player, I'm blown away that this franchise still doesn't give you any freedom in customization. Why can't i edit players stats if i want? why cant i disable objectives and prevent being fired? why cant i track player statistics across multiple seasons? there are plenty of restrictions set in an offline mode that just make it harder and less enjoyable.

Not to say its a better game by any means, but there are certainly some features in NBA 2k My GM mode that would be huge addition to the latest stale and pitiful installment of FIFA

content:
Posted: October 11
While the gameplay engine and general feel of the game is good, the changes doesnt warrant spending money on this iteration of EA's football games over the previous.

Minimal changes to the various single player focused modes, menus that freeze on occasion, FUT is a sad state of affairs and the same bugs (Albeit funny when it happens) during matches.

This being said, I am a huge fan of the series and the sport and the sweet claws of addiction coaxed me into paying for the full product even if I knew full well that I couldve stayed with 23 until a sale came through

All in all, FC24 is not a substantial upgrade over the previous titles from EA, would not recommend paying the full price.

5/10

content:
Posted: October 10
On windows 11 anti cheat seems to have issues launching. All fixes on the internet haven't worked for me. Usually on my laptop (win11) when trying to launch it'll say there's an anti cheat issue. After roghly 30 minutes to an hour it'll prompt me to relaunch the game and then it works fine. No issues I've come across on win10.

For the game play itself.. Its quite good. The game runs really smooth. Some player models are left to be desired. The acrobatic overhead shots look pretty awesome. The AI are much smarter on the harder difficulties. The one thing I would like from EA is to tweak the goal keepers. They never make saves its terrible. For me the star of the show is the dribbling. You can dribble circles around opponent.

My first FC/FIFA game and I'm thoroughly enjoying it. Started playing the mobile version which is pretty fun as well, then wanted to check out the PC version. It' EA, which I'm not a big fan of, but the game itself isn't bad. Playing with keyboard and mouse was a bit painful as it didn't seem possible to get rid of the mouse directional indicator. Plugged in my wife's Xbox One controller and the game has become a lot more enjoyable. I still prefer mouse and keyboard, but the KB/M input for this game leaves a lot to be desired.

content:
Posted: October 10
This game is a not funny joke. I pre ordered EA SPORTS FC 24 to play for 10 hours before the release date, but I couldn't make it run. I thought that it's just a little problem so I uninstalled the game and installed it again but still nothing. The game didn't start the next day as well. I'm really disappointed, because I've already fallen behind in UT so much and that's 100% not my fault. In the following days I tried to repair the game using all of my IT skills (nothing worked), I asked ea support for help, but so far our 20+ messages conversation led to nothing, they were responding really fast but now it feels like they've surrendered, because I haven't got any answer for 5 days. I tried every tip from answers.ea.com threads, I watched so many youtube videos with tips, even those from the Indian guys didn't help. EA, A BILLION DOLLAR COMPANY IS HIDING FROM THEIR RESPONSIBILITY AND THEY DIDN'T SAY A WORD EVEN THOUGH A LOT OF PLAYERS IS STRUGGLING WITH THIS ISSUE. SHAME ON YOU EA

content:
Posted: October 8
For the first few hours of EA Sports FC 24, everything feels familiar gameplay-wise, for better and for worse. HyperMotion V and the PlayStation 5’s DualSense controller feedback return make matches realistic, with precise ball and player physics, noticeable field wear and tear, and goal post-shaking haptics. It's hard to deny that there's a lot of attention to detail going into recreating a realistic soccer atmosphere. Unfortunately, the artificial intelligence part of the Hypermotion V technology that has been so heavily advertised doesn't live up to the hype. While Kinetic Shielding makes for some exciting battles, players still fall all over each other in unnatural ways. Advanced machine learning, which is pretty much a fancy way of saying constantly improving AI, is also hit-or-miss. Your goalkeepers will sometimes stand sideways and let an easy shot in or punch a ball that could have been caught, AI teammates make terrible attacking or defensive decisions that would have Harry Maguire blushing, and you'll likely find yourself yelling about an incorrect passing input more than once a match despite knowing you angled a perfect through ball with your sticks.

content:
Posted: October 7
The best football video game on the market right now.
I love how the animation gets better every year, real gamers can tell that apart from everyone talking about this game every year it's the same game just a different update, I think this is the way to go for a football video game.
There is room for improvement in other segments such as career modes and a lot of room to enable an EDIT section for video game players.
A big minus in my opinion is that every year EA avoids putting the Serbian national team and their two clubs Crvena zvezda and Partizan Beograd into the game. What is the real reason? These two clubs are a good marketing move anyway.

content:
Posted: October 7
EAFC24: a Bug's life - same story every year. PC-STEAM gets the beta version.
- Game always opens 1:3, need to spam maximize for it to go full screen. Launch options don't fix
- Won 3 games in Draft, halfway into the final, lost connection to EA servers, up 4-1, forfeited 0-3
- Can't change custom camera angles and zoom, stuck in default settings
- No commentary - fixed now at least

Pros - Gameplay smoother
- Alisha Lehmann
Cons - Everything else
- Alisha Lehmann not up to scale

Am I still going to play? Yes
Why? *insert Nespresso George Clooney*: "What Else"

content:
Posted: October 6
Not a ton of changes from the previous year, though the offline gameplay has been pretty enjoyable so far at least. Definitely a ton of bugs, including some functionalities being completely unusable as a result; such as drop in matches for clubs and being able to release coaching staff to hire better ones. I've been enjoying the actual gameplay, players feel like they have more of a weight to them and im particularly enjoying the "advanced defending" controls (even though im still kinda trash, especially online). These defending controls definitely feel more reasonable to control what kind of challenges you're putting in.

overall, its solid; but I dont think its worth full price. worth a shot if it goes on sale or you get a deal if you're an offline player.

online is a shambles

content:
Posted: October 4
Playing on the 10 Hour EA Play free trial.

Pros:

Some aspects of the game mechanics are much improved and performance seems better (so far, no laggy cut scenes and fewer random freezes) but at the expense of graphics. I'm not sure why the graphics quality seems so bad using the same setting as 22 and 23.

The new system for transfer is much improved and the ability to "talk" (not really) with an agent is a great addition to the game.

Cons:

Some bugs persist and there are some new ones. Maybe most annoyingly, if you are selected for a national team and your league and cup matches are not rescheduled, you are punished for poor performance for missing them. Since you cannot opt out of national team play, this is odd. I imagine this remains true for injuries as it did in the past, but I have not had a serious injury.

You still progress through levels too quickly. In 9 hours of play in EFL League 2, I have an 82 rated striker. Could be higher, too. The other striker on the team has a 60 rating. It creates a ridiculous gap and an unrealistic opportunity for progression through the leagues and up the league table when you can literally just run around the opposing team.

The dynamics of the game still feel like they were programmed by someone who doesn't understand the sport. Backward passes being immediately kicked back rather than being able to be used as a way to reset the midfield is still a problem, but now more than previous versions the midfield is an absolute mess. There's no apparently zone or man playing, just attacking the ball. This is annoying at first, but then it becomes too easy to beat just by passing the ball to the wings and now you have a person wide open able to run down the field while everyone moves back to their zones.

The manager's points or whatever they're called have approved in some areas (you now actually get credit for important offensive plays besides goals and assists) but you rapidly lose points for things that have nothing to do with you. Guarding your mark so they won't be open for a pass and a pass goes to someone else? Somehow, you should have known that. I think this is related to the midfield problem above where there are no proper fluid zones but rather the idea that you should simultaneously always be attacking the ball but also always in an offensive position even if you're on defense.

I think the game is worth it over 23 if you're paying full price for either. Play 23 on EA Play and wait for 24 to get there otherwise. If you're frustrated with 23, know that you will still be frustrated (and in whole new ways) with 24.

content:
Posted: October 4
I actually cannot for the life of me comprehend how EA get away with releasing an unfinished 'new' version of this every single year. I used to buy FIFA yearly, mostly just to play pro clubs with friends. I held off on this since transitioning to PC, due to the lack of cross-platform on Clubs, which was a weird play from EA over the past couple of years - Anyway, they introduced it this year so my friends and I have grabbed a copy each.

Holy wow was it a bad decision, the game feels worse than it did 5 years ago. It feels like an ALPHA version of the game: the servers are horrible, it takes longer to get into a drop-in match than it does to actually play the entire length of one, the virtual pro customisation is HORRIBLE, it used to be so much more intuitive and easy to make your player look like you, or whoever you want. Ultimate team is laughable, the whole micro-transaction-pay-to-win shizz needs addressing 10 years ago, let alone now - The menus are horrible and unresponsive. The new animations pre-game are just cringe-worthy, the music played before drop-in matches is too loud for the commentary, the commentary is an insta volume 0 for me - I have seen THOUSANDS of complaints online about glitches, issues connecting to games, lag, stuttering in-game, etc.

FC24 just feels like yet another desperate attempt to take your money while papering over the cracks with unnecessary and over the top features that do not improve the gameplay in the slightest. If you're gonna get this game because you play with friends, etc., wait until it's at least half the price. Hopefully over the coming months they actually update the game enough for it to be playable.

EA and Activision need to take a page out of other game studios' books and just release ONE game and let it run for 5+ years with regular updates, so gamers are spending their hard-earned money on an optimised and pleasant gaming experience.

content:
Posted: October 3
I can't believe I got suckered into buying another EA game. I thought after losing the rights to the "FIFA" title they would step up and put out a respectable game, but once again its basically a copy-paste of the last several editions with minor updates and still so many things broken. Career mode has always been my favorite way to play, but it is pathetic and hasn't received any real attention in years. Dynamic potential is beyond broken for the 4th straight year and has never been fixed. This company cares about nothing but money and this game is a clear reflection of a company that does not care about the product that they put out.

content:
Posted: October 3
Dude, its just crazy. EA manages each year to release both the best and worst football simulation.

If you look at the game from a base point, its great. Lots of content, good graphics, fun gameplay, licences... There is lots to be loved and if you are a casual how just wants to play a few games with friends its cool.

But holy ♥♥♥♥. Skipped the last two years and still, there is almost nothing new or exciting. Sure some new cutscenes and changed graphics, but other than that? only minimal improvments, if you can call them that at all.

And the bugs! Oh my god the bugs... Clipping, wrong graphics, no graphics, misplaces grapgics, wrong-scaled interfaces. input-lag, worng input-read, no input-read, players disappering, kits not showing, misspelling. The list just keeps going on and on.

A Francise as big as EAFC (FIFA) should at least be putting some of their billions into game design and game fixing. EAFC is one of the few games that everybody plays and if you ask, nobody will tell you they actually enjoyed playing it.

Its great value for money, but holy ♥♥♥♥ the game is broken.

content:
Posted: October 3
It's my first time buying a FIFA (now FC) at launch since 2015, and I have to say that the game has improved a lot in terms of gameplay if more competitive style games are your thing, tho this is mostly talking about Ultimate Team, in other aspects the game feels the same or even worse, just minor upgrades in some areas, and completely abandoned in others. I would recommend it if you are itching for a football gacha.

Ultimate Team is more fun than ever I would say, all the new gamemodes and ways to get players without having to spend money feel good in contrast with FIFA 2013 or 2015. Building your club is a nice experience, and the learning curve for the gameplay itself is interesting, has a lot of skillcap and feels rewarding.

Other gamemodes which are fun don't have that many players in them, and feel like they could really use an upgrade in terms of progress and showing off cool stuff that you can achieve, they feel dated and incomplete stuck in 2013.

content:
Posted: October 3
This game is typical of any EA backed game. Absolutely terrible at launch, copy and paste from last years game and 80% of the features don't even work. I find the new features to be a needed addition to the slow and monotonous ultimate team gameplay. Clubs, the most exciting and communal part of the entire electronic soccer/football space, literally does not work. If you were here to play with friends, DO NOT LET THE MARKETING FOOL YOU!!! YOU CANNOT CONNECT CROSS-PLAT!!! sure the game may have the infrastructure for cross platform play but not a single feature works for it, so, understand this was simply an advertising scheme. All new features become stale after roughly 43hrs of play and the game feels utterly soulless. If I can save just one person's money, please DO NOT PURCHASE.

Would really appreciate a refund or, better yet, 15% down on their stock overnight would work too.

content:
Posted: October 3
So it's a copy and paste game, but worse. On legendary you literally cant defend against AI. They cant be tackled, every shot is on target, and every rebound goes to an AI player. The graphics are some how worse, the cut scenes are blurry. Like, what the hell is going on? On one of the deep dive videos it says you can create a stadium on career, but yet its only on UT, which is trash. I love the sport, i love Borussia Dortmund. And it sucks that this is the only game i play to even feel closer to the real game. EA you need to step your game up, and big time. Make a lot of changes, add more stuff to career. This game can have it all, but ya'll choose not to do anything about it. You care about UT cause it brings in quick cash thats it. I dont recommend this game, and I've purchased every single title since 2009.
