content:
Posted: October 2
When I play online, I play against not only another person,
I play against terrible gameplay with annoying delay before each gamepad operation.
I play against inaccurate passes which don't match with my stick direction.
I play against broken interceptions when your defender already get the ball but it go to opponent by some magical consequences.
I play against 71 deep + pressing tactic which actually broken and you cannot do anything except of ball losing.
I play against broken R1 dribbling which allow average players dribble like Ronaldinho in prime time.
I play against Dynamic Difficulty Adjustment in match, when goalkeeper of your opponent can save every dead ball, but yours can't save anything.
I play against opponent AI bots in defending, which often defend better than opponent and do some unbelievable tackles without opponent actions.
I play against slow players with pace 60 who can easy run faster than Al Owairan with max pace stats.
I play against my stupid goalkeeper who cannot save ball which fly right in his body. Even if I move him by right stick and match with shooting direction, animation of my goalkeeper broken and don't match with reality.
I play against broken physics, when VVD can be pushed by player which is totally less than him in one and a half time.
I play against kick off glitches when you understand that opponent will score because of strange behaviour of my players.

If you want to buy this game to play online you should understand that you won't be able to control major part of actions in matches. In lots of cases it's not a game about "if you click buttons better than opponent you win", it's a game about scripts, handicap (DDA), glitches, bad connections and broken behaviour of players.

EA don't want to fix this issues by years, because community don't have another football game.
EA just want to sell you new 100 rare players pack for 50 dollars.

Totally don't recommend this game if you want to play online.

THE WORST EA GAME EVER!
This game is such a garbage. The gameplay is unbelievably bad. Goalkeepers cannot do anything in the goal. Any free kick, finesse shot or outside foot shot is 100% a goal. Don't try to do anything to stop that, especially if the player has the gold playstyle.
The defence is funny, no tackles, no interceptions, make the AI plays for you.
As well, there are too many rebounds.
EA only develops in graphics, which does not benefit players in the game, and forgets the main thing "gameplay"

Do not spend £89 on this trash game, until EA fixes every single bug they imported from FIFA23. I swear you will miss your life and friends and get nervous and anxious.

content:
Posted: October 2
EA Drops the Ball Again!

Ugh, FC24 is here, and it's a letdown - big time. First off, the microtransactions are just too much. So, what could have been a tribute to soccer ends up feeling more like a costly slot machine where spending money is key to getting a competitive squad. Honestly, it probably shouldn’t even be legal.

And where’s the new stuff? The game works, sure. But it's the same-old, same-old, year after year. We’ve been yelling about this forever, but EA's just not listening.

We really need EA to take a break, skip a year, and give us something awesome and NEW next time. How about diving into a footballer’s life with a cool, open-world feature (think GTA vibes)? That would let us really get into our football fantasies and feel fresh and fun.

In short, EA, it's time to step up. No more grabbing our cash and handing us the same thing every year. We want to see something big and new – and we're waiting!

content:
Posted: October 2
an honest review from a decent player, this fifa or she fc as others want to call it is one of the best soccer games ever released by her, all the negative comments are mostly left by players of maximum div 8 9 , a fairly experienced player can tell you that the game is brilliant, the passes are responsive, the players feel very realistic and unique and some say that the players feel slow which is very false, if we were playing ultimate team it is absolutely normal to play with weaker cards because it's the beginning of the game, you can't expect on the first day with a gold team to play like a futties. You have several versatile cards that can be evolved which makes the game brilliant at the beginning. And for those who they complain about women is very simple, don't play with them in the team, you are not obliged, and if you get beaten try to play better, definitely don't get beaten because the opponent has women in the team. the game as a whole is among the most good fifas released in recent years, whoever doesn't recognize this most likely can't get out of division 7 6

content:
Posted: October 1
Playstyles are interesting, sprint dribbling is great, female players add a new dimension.

But... the qa/qc on this game is the worst I have ever experienced in a EA game (which is saying something).

Players are glitching (Hegerberg), objectives are broken, the companion app on multiple platforms crashes on button presses.

It would be bad if it was just a single purchase, but EA has created a market in FUT. Having software that is this bad, with the amount of money flowing through it, is unforgivable.

This is the game that ended for me.

Product refunded

Мав велике бажання знову пограти у фіфу, але ця гра наразі повне розчарування. Довелося повернути.

Перше знайомство з грою почалося із вильоту при її загрузці. Після гугління допомогло запуск в оффлайн режимі. Проте гра все ще корешала при будь-якій спробі підключитись до сервера.

Щодо геймплею, то від не сильно змінився і з тим що я бачив грав років. З новенько тут постійні підлагування.

За такі гроші купувати гру, яка працюю лиш в офлейні і постійно лагає я не рекомендую

content:
Posted: October 1
I'm not a massive footy fan but fancied playing something different, usually play driving sims and shoot em ups .

Decided to opt for the EA Play for 10 hours option as sixty odd quid wouldn't be money well spent for me.

I have a fairly high end machine to play this on, RTX 4070 , 32gb DDR400 ram and a core i5 9600 cpu .

The game runs maxed out at 4k and 120hz ( LG 55in oled tv with 120hz refresh rate screen ) and not had any issues as suggested in the reviews.

Seems to play ok and I've had about an hour of fun with it so far.

content:

It's clunky with many game breaking bugs. I only play career mode, but the number of times I've had to shut down the game because some options are bugged is too high.

The real letdown is that many of these game-breaking bugs were known (i.e., posted on EA forum) during 'early access' before official launch, but there was no remediation upon actual launch. There is an apparent lack of commitment to making a good game and a lack of commitment to fixing prevailing issues ASAP.

content:
Posted: October 1
Year after year, EA, despite being one of the highest grossing video game company of all-time, you fail to actually deliver a product on release day that is reflective of its price. People are paying a premium for your games every year, and are met with some of the most lacklustre, mundane and boring features every year. Sure, you can blame us for continuing to buy the game, but the truth is, I love football. You love football. And FIFA/EA Sports FC is the only game out there that can scratch that itch. There are no viable competitors. Therefore, through our love for the beautiful game that is football, we keep buying it. And you know that, EA. That is why you refuse to actually do some hard coding in your game and add new features/improve the game.

You are too busy milking all the 12-year old FUTwhales that spend mum and dad's money on your stupid packs, which is all that ultimately matters to you in the end. You do not care that Career Mode has not been proper innovated since the dawn of Jesus Christ, or that Pro Clubs has so much untapped potential. All that matters to you, is FUT, and the whales that keep splashing thousands upon thousands every year, only for all of their players, items, to be obsolete the following iteration of FIFA/EAFC.

I would also like to point out that, despite us paying the same amount, the level of disrespect you have continuously shown us PC players is unforgivable. Not just this year, but every other year. Do not think we have forgot about the absolute disaster of a release that was FIFA 21, FIFA 22 and FIFA 23. If you are lucky enough to even launch the game, you are most likely met with terrible FPS, choppy animations, bugged out player models, and honestly, the list is endless if I wanted it to be. Speaking of lists, I am going to provide one with all of the bugs that I encountered in my first few hours of game-play.

→ Choppy animations, frames drop and becomes an eye-sore to watch.
→ Commentary does not work on launch. There is 0 commentary.
→ Player models, the hair, bugs out when it is rainy and foggy. Becomes pixelated.
→ Can not connect to the internet (whatever this means).
→ Controllers not working properly.
→ Game keeps minimising on PC.
→ The game is not opening and launching for so many players.
→ Can not sack coaches in Career Mode, it just freezes.
→ Objectives not counting.
→ Not getting XP when completing objectives.
→ The game freezes on the EA FC logo.
→ Stuck in half-time animation.
→ Game-play stutter.
→ Overall TERRIBLE performance even on high-end hardware.
→ Anti-cheat error message.
→ Media questions still make 0 sense.
→ Same animations for media interviews and transfers.
→ Same animations for injuries, etc. 0 innovation and creativity here.
→ Menu in FUT will freeze and you have to close the game and launch it again.
→ If you navigate the menu too quickly, it messes up and goes all over your screen.

Again, like mentioned, this list could be as long as you want it to be. The point is, you are incompetent EA, and you are ESPECIALLY incompetent when it comes to creating a proper PC port. But of course, because you know we love football and we simply have no other alternatives, you can keep getting away with this. I am an idiot for playing this game and "enabling it" and I know I am, but that is not going to stop me from speaking out about the disgrace of a company you run.

Also, why on Earth would you remove players walking out onto the pitch and lining up before a game? What went on in your heads over there at EA when you thought, hmm, let us replace this key part of immersion building and realism and replace it with a few stupid cutscenes then immediately throw you into the game where everyone is already on the pitch ready to go. What about Champions League nights, important finals, etc? There is no immersion anymore. You do not get to watch your team walk out, line up, with the anthem roaring in the background, your players lined up and ready to battle it out... it just sends you straight into action. This is SO stupid. As a Career Mode enjoyer (shock, I know right, cause who still willingly plays this neglected mode?) this totally kills off getting any sort of feeling towards your games, especially big ones. Mind-boggling decision. Begs the question, in typical EA fashion, what iteration of EA FC will you bring this back and market it as a "brand new, immersive feature"?

Hey guys, so in the past few days I had big stutters on the start of cutscenes (FK, PEN, Corner, Goal celebration, etc.). What seemed to fix the issue is putting Rendering quality, grass quality to medium and crows quality to low and No Limit FPS. It reduced the stuttering heavily, still not perfect but much better. Only downside is that we can't fully enjoy the good graphics since I assume its the Render issue if you put it above medium but it is what it is.

content:
Posted: September 30
For gameplay, the game does feel a little more different and slower paced than previous FIFA titles. For starters, you actually have to aim directly at a player for a pass to complete (except for through ball) and aim precisely at the goal to score. Any off positioning can cost you a loss of possession or missing the entire goal. There are new goalkeeper mechanics that I have noticed help more than hurt, especially 1 on 1s. Overall, my initial rating for the gameplay is an 8/10.

As far as user experience, I just don't like the UI. It literally looks like a preset lower budget interface. Holding down your left trigger in ultimate team to scroll to what you want is just over-complicated compared to FIFA 23 where you had everything on one page. Also, I shouldn't lose a contract on my starting 11 when my opponent in UT quits the game on kickoff. I just could never understand why, especially if the game recognizes who it was that quit. Overall, I rate the user experience a 5/10. It's not the worst but can definitely be worked on.

content:
Posted: September 30
It's FIFA 23 with new lighting. Don't bother.

I was initially excited for this, and I don't know why, really. FIFA 23 for the last couple months was buggy to the point of being unplayable, not to mention the game would randomly crash during every match. I was hoping that some of the bugs and text mistakes and gameplay issues that have been in the game since FIFA 20 would have been resolved, but no. ALL of the bugs from the last 4 FIFA games are back. At least it hasn't crashed on me mid-match (yet).

Unlike the last 4 games, this one doesn't run as well for some reason. I have a 13900k, 4080, 64 GB of RAM and have the game installed on a SSD. FIFA 23 ran at a smooth 120 FPS in game with all the settings cranked. EAFC 24 runs at a choppy 80-90. It's not unplayable, but the graphics are the same, the cutscenes are the same, the player models are the same aside from the presentation and some better shadows the game looks the same as last year, so I don't really understand why it doesn't run as well. The really confusing thing is that when I'm looking at GPU usage it's only at about 70% and CPU is at 2 or 3%, so my hardware isn't really being taxed and the game's performance is worse... for some reason.

My time so far has been spent in Manager Career mode, so my experience with the game is limited to that, ATM. I will update after I've played the game a bit more. TL;DR will be at the bottom. As for the game itself:

Cutscenes are recycled from FIFA 23, which is unwelcome, as they were a massive annoyance to me from the previous game. I swear to god if I have to watch EVERY ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ NEW SIGNING doing that stupid treadmill run I'm going to lose my damn mind. And why do I have to watch as my 3rd string youth-level GK leaves the club lobby depressingly as he goes out on loan? I don't care, that's why he's leaving. I don't need a sad little cutscene to tell me he's leaving. Just have him leave. If it were a player that's been a regular starter with the club for a couple years, fine, but it isn't. The one cutscene I wish they'd kept is the walkout of the tunnel before a match where they go over the lineups for each team. That's gone. You still get to choose your walkout anthem for your club in the customization menu, which is strange seeing as how the instance where that's used doesn't seem to be in the game anymore, so what's the point? Yellow card/red card cutscenes are exactly the same animations but filmed from the point of view of the referee... which doesn't look good. I've had a couple instances where the ref's hair clips through the camera. It's also got a fisheye effect on it, like it's supposed to be a bodycam or something. Idk, it just doesn't look good.

So as far as manager customization goes, they've added some boring-looking shorts, some more boring-looking shirts, hoodies, and 4 pairs of glasses. That's. About. It. I know there's more customization options in Volta for your player, including tattoos and more facial hair options (I will gladly take an comically-sized handlebar mustache) so why doesn't that transfer into the manager creator? Oh, yeah, Volta customization can be monetized and EA are money grubbers. Good news, though, EA, (and I can't believe I'm suggesting this) make the options for character customization in Volta available in Career mode and monetize them like you would in Volta or FUT. Players get better customization (albeit at a cost) and you potentially get more money. Everyone sort-of gets what they want, or at least it's consistent with the rest of the game. Kits are largely the same, some new selections, but not many. One kit option shows up twice for some reason. There are also KITS WITH SPONSORS WOOOOOOO!!! What sponsors are they? EAFC, Frostbite, Truemotion, and one other EAFC-centric one I can't be bothered to remember. There is one kit for each of them and that's it. Also, while I'm ranting: Why can't I have a color slider or color wheel for choosing my kit and badge colors? I get to choose from 10 colors for badges and 30ish(? I'm not counting them) colors for my kit. What's so hard about a color mixer option? The colors for badges don't mix with the colors for kits unless I choose basic colors, which just looks like every other club in the game. It's so lazy. I'm grateful that I can choose to customize a custom team, but there's better means of customization in other EA games. Dragon Age Inquisition is in Frostbite and uses a color mixer, so don't tell me it's not possible with the hundreds of people that work on this game every year. And how do they still not have icons for some of the hairstyles? A couple of them are literally just regen character heads with the hair on them, and one of them isn't even the correct hair. One of the icons just shows a bald head and when you select it it puts a hat on your manager. How the hell did this make it past QA? Is there even QA at this point? Probably not.

The gameplay this year is probably the only improvement I've noted besides the lighting model (I'll get to that later). Players collide with each other in more realistic ways, They seem to have fixed players with explosive running trait actually running like a drunk slug, and the gameplay feels arcadey but not like pinball. Another addition is that when simming a match, instead of watching dots slide around on a JPEG of a pitch you can watch the game from the sideline like a manager would and make changes from the sideline.

As I mentioned before, bugs from the last 4 games and beyond are still here. Missing text, placeholder textures, flickering shadows in the background of some cutscenes, all this on top of the usual shenanigans you get during a match. In my first match alone I had a player fly 20 feet into the air after a tackle, watched another player run into and get stuck in the ad boards behind the goal, and the player who scored a hat trick went to get the match ball from the refs and the ball hovered in the air while the player walked away pretending to hold the ball. It's a mess. I don't understand how some of these bugs have been part of this game for several years and they never get fixed. It's downright ridiculous and shameful at this point.


I like the improvement to the match day gameplay and graphics, but everything else about this game is either a step back or the exact same as the last few FIFA's. Most of my time with FIFA games is spent in the menus between matches managing players and formations, scouting new players, so on and so forth and the updated UI just isn't good. It looks pretty, but it's less functional than previous entries. The bugs are just as bad as they've ever been and likely to get worse because EA is notoriously bad at fixing their games. They've removed things from the game that actively make it better and the things they leave in don't work properly. It's all a proper mess. And the fact they have the nerve to charge $70 for this garbage is just infuriating. Especially when I know the modes that have the predatory micro-transactions have better options to them.

I've already gone past the 2 hour return threshold so I can't get my money back at this point, otherwise I would be returning this game. The only thing left to do it to put hundreds of hours into this game and hope it gets better with time. That being said, there's not a lot of better options. eFootball is in the same boat, but with fewer licensed teams (also ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥) and Football Manager is little more than a spreadsheet simulator with more depth. IDK what to tell you other than go spend your money on Baldur's Gate or Starfield or something worth your time from developers that care about their games.

It's just not a finished game. Servers constantly booting me, game is buggy in areas too numerous to mention, players fly off around the pitch randomly.... there's just a lot wrong. If this had to be released on a disc, they would not have gone to print in its current state. They just rely on the patches and updates to band aid over the systemic failures that consistently plague EA Fifa/Fc games. It's called exploitation folks, and year after year we gobble it up! EA you have a responsibility to do better...its not like you can't afford it.

content:
Posted: September 30
Absolute buggy mess as always.
No attention paid to single player again.
Predatory gambling aimed at children.
If you start the game with keyboard, there is no way to change to controller, you have to quit the game and take the loss.
buggy UI
Crashes to desktop
Pace is king again, - The only way to win is to have the fastest players.. cause that's how football works.. right.. Doesn't matter what overall they are, could be a 50 rated player from 4th tier of football, as long as they have 95 pace they're GOATed.
Goalkeepers randomly fall over.
SCRIPTING IS WORSE THAN EVER. WHATEVER YOU DO NEVER GO 2 GOALS UP. - YOU WILL LOSE 3-2 IT'S ALREADY BEEN DECIDED BY A POWER GREATER THAN OURS (ea).
Players will play like they're stuck in the mud if you're playing a promotion game, that way they can make it harder to let you move up the divisions and thus make you feel like you need to GAMBLE more.
Everything in this game pushes you towards their 'loot boxes' or we might was well call it what it is, the 'EA CEO retirement fund' cause that money clearly isn't being put back into the development of the game.

DON'T BUY IT.
